You’ll support data-driven decision-making across the enterprise by building and evaluating statistical and machine learning models, designing experiments, and creating clear visualizations to communicate insights. We’re looking for someone who can work independently, solve complex problems, and clearly explain technical findings to non-technical audiences.Who You’ll Work WithThe Nike Intelligence Center powers and protects Nike’s competitive advantage by providing insights into global trends, risks, and issues that intersect with the company’s business and operations. This role will work with cross-functional partners across Resilience, Global Technology and others across Nike. You will create data-driven insights and visualizations built on internal and external data sets . Our data products tell stories that reveal patterns and trends that enable effective decision making for our partners and stakeholders.What You’ll Work OnDeveloping and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze relevant structured and unstructured datasets and variablesDeveloping ML models and planning end-to-end ML model experiment design Applying hypothesis testing, regression, A/B testing and time-series forecasting to product creation decisions and timelinesWorking closely with innovation and engineering teams to build, support, and scale these data-driven insights to stakeholders across the enterprisePerforming data and error analysis to improve model performanceCreating clear and compelling visualizations to communicate findings and recommendationsIdentifying and making recommendations on analytical tools and methodsMonitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, ensuring high availability and performanceIdentify and tackle issues concerning data management to improve data qualityDesign, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT data pipelines, reusable components, frameworks, and libraries to process data from various sources ensuring data quality and consistencyWhat You BringBachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field. We will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.5+ years of progressive analytics and data visualization experience3+ years’ experience with Tableau3+ years of experience building models 3+ years of deep learning, neural network algorithm developmentExpertise in languages like Python, R, and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and model buildingExperience in predictive analytics, forecasting, A/B testing, complex modeling and data analysisProven experience developing and running simulation and optimization tools to support decision makingAbility to visualize data to tell stories that resonate with executive level stake holders.Ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way to non-technical audiences,Experience with cloud tools for data science, machine learning and modeling, and visualization e.g., Jupyter Notebooks, RStudio, pandas, PySpark, SageMaker, Databricks, MLFlow, Tableau, PowerBIExperience with ETL/ELT processes and data warehousing conceptsExcellent problem-solving skills and the ability to design solutions for complex data challengesWe offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.
descriptionHtml:
Who We Are Looking For

We’re looking for a Global Intelligence Analyst II to join the Data Analytics Intelligence team in the Nike Intelligence Center. You’ll support data-driven decision-making across the enterprise by building and evaluating statistical and machine learning models, designing experiments, and creating clear visualizations to communicate insights. We’re looking for someone who can work independently, solve complex problems, and clearly explain technical findings to non-technical audiences.

Who You’ll Work With

The Nike Intelligence Center powers and protects Nike’s competitive advantage by providing insights into global trends, risks, and issues that intersect with the company’s business and operations. This role will work with cross-functional partners across Resilience, Global Technology and others across Nike. You will create data-driven insights and visualizations built on internal and external data sets . Our data products tell stories that reveal patterns and trends that enable effective decision making for our partners and stakeholders.

What You’ll Work On

  • Developing and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze relevant structured and unstructured datasets and variables
  • Developing ML models and planning end-to-end ML model experiment design
  • Applying hypothesis testing, regression, A/B testing and time-series forecasting to product creation decisions and timelines
  • Working closely with innovation and engineering teams to build, support, and scale these data-driven insights to stakeholders across the enterprise
  • Performing data and error analysis to improve model performance
  • Creating clear and compelling visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations
  • Identifying and making recommendations on analytical tools and methods
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, ensuring high availability and performance
  • Identify and tackle issues concerning data management to improve data quality
  • Design, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT data pipelines, reusable components, frameworks, and libraries to process data from various sources ensuring data quality and consistency

What You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field. We will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.
  • 5+ years of progressive analytics and data visualization experience
  • 3+ years’ experience with Tableau
  • 3+ years of experience building models
  • 3+ years of deep learning, neural network algorithm development
  • Expertise in languages like Python, R, and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and model building
  • Experience in predictive analytics, forecasting, A/B testing, complex modeling and data analysis
  • Proven experience developing and running simulation and optimization tools to support decision making
  • Ability to visualize data to tell stories that resonate with executive level stake holders.
  • Ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way to non-technical audiences,
  • Experience with cloud tools for data science, machine learning and modeling, and visualization e.g., Jupyter Notebooks, RStudio, pandas, PySpark, SageMaker, Databricks, MLFlow, Tableau, PowerBI
  • Experience with ETL/ELT processes and data warehousing concepts
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to design solutions for complex data challenges

We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

descriptionHtml:
Company Description

Farther is a rapidly growing RIA that combines expert advisors with cutting-edge technology - delivering a comprehensive, tailored wealth management experience.

Farther’s founders are leaders and innovators from the private wealth industry who possess a unique blend of traditional wealth management, fintech, and technology production expertise. We’re backed by top-tier venture capital firms, fintech investors, and industry leaders.

Joining Farther means joining a collaborative team of entrepreneurs who are passionate about helping their clients and our teammates achieve more. If you’re the type who breaks through walls to get things done the right way, we want to build the future of wealth management with you.

The Role 

Join our Finance team as a Business Intelligence Analyst where you'll transform raw data into strategic insights that drive our business forward. This role is perfect for someone passionate about dashboard development and communicating data-driven value to stakeholders across the organization.

Your Impact 
  • Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reporting solutions that provide visibility into key financial and operational metrics using BI tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.)
  • Transform and analyze data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, spreadsheets) to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights
  • Collaborate with stakeholders across finance, operations, and leadership to understand reporting requirements and define critical KPIs
  • Monitor data quality and ensure accuracy of all business intelligence deliverables
  • Present findings and strategic recommendations to management and cross-functional teams
  • Support ad-hoc data analysis requests and contribute to business case development
The Ideal Match 
  • Strong proficiency in BI visualization tools (Tableau, Looker) and advanced Excel capabilities
  • Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and analysis
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail and data accuracy
  • Knowledge of database systems and data warehousing concepts
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with passion for translating data into compelling narratives
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related quantitative field
Bonus Points 
  • 2-4 years experience combining finance and data analytics, ideally in corporate finance, fintech, consulting, or analytics-focused roles
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Background in financial services or wealth management industry
  • Experience building dashboards that directly influenced strategic business decisions
Why Join Us

Ready to disrupt wealth management? Let's talk!

descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

descriptionHtml:
Important information: To be immediately considered, please send an updated version of your resume to somp767@kellyservices.com.


Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Senior Analyst, IS Business Intelligence)

Location: REMOTE

Duration: 3 months

Pay rate: $45 per hour

W2 Contract (No C2C)


Top 3 skills

  • Databricks
  • Power BI
  • Database Diagraming


Years of experience: Over 5 years


Job Summary:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Intelligence Specialist to lead the design and support of enterprise-wide BI applications and architecture. This individual contributor role requires strong analytical skills, technical expertise, and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate will also have experience working with cybersecurity data and a passion for driving data-informed decision-making across the organization.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design and support of enterprise-wide business intelligence applications and architecture.
  • Collaborate with business and IT senior management to understand and prioritize data and information requirements.
  • Solve complex technical problems related to BI systems and data architecture.
  • Optimize performance of BI tools by defining valuable data filters and indexes.
  • Create and implement testing methodologies and criteria for BI solutions.
  • Design and coordinate training programs to coach users on BI tools and enhance decision-making capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain standards, policies, and procedures for BI tools and systems.
  • Establish and monitor data/information quality metrics.
  • Research emerging technologies and develop business cases for enterprise-wide BI solutions.
  • Work with product cybersecurity data and the data team to ingest, normalize, transform, and query various datasets related to Stryker products.
  • Apply data security best practices when handling sensitive product and cybersecurity-related information.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or related roles.
  • Strong understanding of BI tools, data modeling, and performance optimization.
  • Experience working with cybersecurity data is highly desirable.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment.
  • Attention to detail and ability to make evaluative judgments based on factual analysis.
title: Data Analyst

description: Hybrid schedule (2-3 days onsite in El Segundo)4-6 month contract with possibility of extending Aerospace company so USC only Job SummaryWe are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Power BI Developer to join our analytics team. The ideal candidate will possess strong SQL skills, experience building robust Power BI reports and dataflows, and a solid understanding of supply chain, inventory, manufacturing, or design engineering domains. This role requires a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights with a focus on accuracy and performance optimization.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, apps, and dataflows to support business decision-making.Write and optimize SQL queries to ensure efficient data retrieval from various sources.Collaborate with business users and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations.Conduct data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and integrity of reported data.Analyze and troubleshoot performance issues related to data models, queries, and dashboards.Work closely with cross-functional teams in supply chain, inventory, manufacturing, or design engineering to understand data needs and business processes.Document data models, dataflows, and reporting standards to ensure maintainability and scalability.Required QualificationsProven experience with Power BI, including creating dashboards, dataflows, and published apps.Strong proficiency in SQL, including query tuning and performance optimization.Excellent data validation and attention to detail skills.Familiarity with business processes and terminology in supply chain, inventory management, manufacturing, or design engineering.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Preferred QualificationsExperience with DAX and Power Query (M).Familiarity with cloud data platforms such as Azure SQL, Synapse, or Snowflake.Experience with source control tools (e.g., Git) and DevOps practices for BI.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
descriptionHtml:
Hybrid schedule (2-3 days onsite in El Segundo)

4-6 month contract with possibility of extending


Aerospace company so USC only

Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Power BI Developer to join our analytics team. The ideal candidate will possess strong SQL skills, experience building robust Power BI reports and dataflows, and a solid understanding of supply chain, inventory, manufacturing, or design engineering domains. This role requires a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights with a focus on accuracy and performance optimization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, apps, and dataflows to support business decision-making.
  • Write and optimize SQL queries to ensure efficient data retrieval from various sources.
  • Collaborate with business users and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations.
  • Conduct data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and integrity of reported data.
  • Analyze and troubleshoot performance issues related to data models, queries, and dashboards.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams in supply chain, inventory, manufacturing, or design engineering to understand data needs and business processes.
  • Document data models, dataflows, and reporting standards to ensure maintainability and scalability.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with Power BI, including creating dashboards, dataflows, and published apps.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL, including query tuning and performance optimization.
  • Excellent data validation and attention to detail skills.
  • Familiarity with business processes and terminology in supply chain, inventory management, manufacturing, or design engineering.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with DAX and Power Query (M).
  • Familiarity with cloud data platforms such as Azure SQL, Synapse, or Snowflake.
  • Experience with source control tools (e.g., Git) and DevOps practices for BI.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
title: PowerBI Developer

description: The Data Analyst supports data infrastructure and transformation initiatives by analyzing backend data requirements and partnering with cross-functional teams to enhance data-driven features and tools. This role contributes to the development of scalable content collection and publication processes, ensures data accuracy and consistency for end users, and provides consultative input on data architecture and usability across systems.What you will do:Analyze and synthesize data requirements for backend data infrastructure.Support Product and Engineering across all data transformation initiatives.Partner with Global Data to develop advanced content collection/publication processes.Consult and advise on data driven features and tools.Create processes that ensure users get consistent, accurate results from the data they rely on.You need to have:Bachelor's degree preferred. Coursework in Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent technical work experience.2 years of professional experience in data analysisDemonstrated experience leveraging strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills to drive process improvements in capturing, storing, enriching, and using data.Experience using Excel or VBA for data analysisProven ability with mark-up languages (XML, SGML and/or HTML) and XPathEqual OpportunityBloomberg Industry Group maintains a continuing policy of non-discrimination in employment. descriptionHtml:
The Data Analyst supports data infrastructure and transformation initiatives by analyzing backend data requirements and partnering with cross-functional teams to enhance data-driven features and tools. This role contributes to the development of scalable content collection and publication processes, ensures data accuracy and consistency for end users, and provides consultative input on data architecture and usability across systems.

What you will do:

  • Analyze and synthesize data requirements for backend data infrastructure.
  • Support Product and Engineering across all data transformation initiatives.
  • Partner with Global Data to develop advanced content collection/publication processes.
  • Consult and advise on data driven features and tools.
  • Create processes that ensure users get consistent, accurate results from the data they rely on.


You need to have:

  • Bachelor's degree preferred. Coursework in Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent technical work experience.
  • 2 years of professional experience in data analysis
  • Demonstrated experience leveraging strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills to drive process improvements in capturing, storing, enriching, and using data.
  • Experience using Excel or VBA for data analysis
  • Proven ability with mark-up languages (XML, SGML and/or HTML) and XPath


Equal Opportunity

Bloomberg Industry Group maintains a continuing policy of non-discrimination in employment. It is Bloomberg Industry Group’s policy to provide equal opportunity and access for all persons, and the Company is committed to attracting, retaining, developing, and promoting the most qualified individuals without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law (“Protected Characteristic”). title: Data Analyst

description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for IBM. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.IntroductionAt IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.Your Role And ResponsibilitiesAs a Junior Data Analyst at IBM, you’ll use the latest tools and technologies available to deliver best in class data analysis, business results and quantifiable return on investment for our business and business partners. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that critical projects for our clients are expertly organized, scheduled, analyzed, communicated and managed to help organizations improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace.Throughout your apprenticeship, you’ll work closely with multiple experienced systems analysts, data scientists and mentors in an interactive, collaborative environment. You’ll learn the fundamentals of data cleansing, synthesis and analysis. You will learn HR IT systems integrations within the SAP Success Factors application. This will include learning how to create functional specifications, understanding basic integration development technology and navigation, and collaboration with HR business partners and Application Partners. In addition, you will be introduced to additional concepts, skills and tools including: scripting and analytics like SPSS, Python, R; Statistical tools like regression analysis, Statistical Process Control; presentation skills, client relationship management skills, Microsoft Excel skills, lean six sigma concepts, Big Data knowledge, agile principles, IBM Design Thinking, communication skills, and finally, you will apply these skills to prepare for and successfully obtain data analytics experience that may lead to certification as a Junior Data Scientist. IBM Certification as a Junior Data Scientist provides the credentials and career milestone that is earned through demonstrated usage of Data Science tools and methodology through case studies, business references and technical references. Our apprenticeship program will give you the opportunity to build your skills to grow your career as a Junior Data Analyst/Systems Analyst.What is an Apprenticeship?IBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.During the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.Who you areAn apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you’ve had some experience with data analysis or simply working in a team oriented environment in the past, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.To Be Successful, You NeedDrive and eagerness to learn Strong problem solving, critical thinking, organization, and communication skills Ability to work independently and take initiative, as well as work collaboratively and contribute to an agile team environment Ability to think analytically in solving problems, know what data is needed to demonstrate a business outcome Some basic knowledge or experience in the following is preferred: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Business systems analysis Lean Six Sigma (Yellow, Green or Black Belts) Basic knowledge of Information Technology Delivery methods Familiarity or use of statistical analysis tools such as Minitab, SPSS Any scripting or programming experience is a plus Familiarity with HR/IT systems and HR business processes. Experienced with Integrations, documentation of technical specification Understanding of the software development cycle What’s the experience?As an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through your first few weeks together, learning about IBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress through your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your project teams. You'll complete milestones along the way, earning digital credentials to validate your skills, and will come back together with other apprentices to participate in on-going training and development focused on your professional and technical skills. Best of all, you are a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities and making choices about how you get the job done just like any other IBMer.Required Technical And Professional ExpertiseWillingness to complete the requirements of the apprenticeship program 0 - 2 years work experience in a customer-oriented role Preferred Technical And Professional ExperienceSome basic knowledge or experience in the following is preferred: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Business systems analysis Lean Six Sigma (Yellow, Green or Black Belts) Basic knowledge of Information Technology Delivery methods Familiarity or use of statistical analysis tools such as Minitab, SPSS Any scripting or programming experience is a plus Familiarity with HR/IT systems and HR business processes. Experienced with Integrations, documentation of technical specification Understanding of the software development cycle IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com
descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for IBM. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role And Responsibilities

As a Junior Data Analyst at IBM, you’ll use the latest tools and technologies available to deliver best in class data analysis, business results and quantifiable return on investment for our business and business partners. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that critical projects for our clients are expertly organized, scheduled, analyzed, communicated and managed to help organizations improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace.

Throughout your apprenticeship, you’ll work closely with multiple experienced systems analysts, data scientists and mentors in an interactive, collaborative environment. You’ll learn the fundamentals of data cleansing, synthesis and analysis. You will learn HR IT systems integrations within the SAP Success Factors application. This will include learning how to create functional specifications, understanding basic integration development technology and navigation, and collaboration with HR business partners and Application Partners. In addition, you will be introduced to additional concepts, skills and tools including: scripting and analytics like SPSS, Python, R; Statistical tools like regression analysis, Statistical Process Control; presentation skills, client relationship management skills, Microsoft Excel skills, lean six sigma concepts, Big Data knowledge, agile principles, IBM Design Thinking, communication skills, and finally, you will apply these skills to prepare for and successfully obtain data analytics experience that may lead to certification as a Junior Data Scientist. IBM Certification as a Junior Data Scientist provides the credentials and career milestone that is earned through demonstrated usage of Data Science tools and methodology through case studies, business references and technical references. Our apprenticeship program will give you the opportunity to build your skills to grow your career as a Junior Data Analyst/Systems Analyst.

What is an Apprenticeship?

IBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.

During the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 12 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.

Who you are

An apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you’ve had some experience with data analysis or simply working in a team oriented environment in the past, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.

To Be Successful, You Need

  • Drive and eagerness to learn
  • Strong problem solving, critical thinking, organization, and communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative, as well as work collaboratively and contribute to an agile team environment
  • Ability to think analytically in solving problems, know what data is needed to demonstrate a business outcome
  • Some basic knowledge or experience in the following is preferred:
  • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Business systems analysis
  • Lean Six Sigma (Yellow, Green or Black Belts)
  • Basic knowledge of Information Technology Delivery methods
  • Familiarity or use of statistical analysis tools such as Minitab, SPSS
  • Any scripting or programming experience is a plus
  • Familiarity with HR/IT systems and HR business processes.
  • Experienced with Integrations, documentation of technical specification
  • Understanding of the software development cycle

What’s the experience?

As an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through your first few weeks together, learning about IBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress through your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your project teams. You'll complete milestones along the way, earning digital credentials to validate your skills, and will come back together with other apprentices to participate in on-going training and development focused on your professional and technical skills. Best of all, you are a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities and making choices about how you get the job done just like any other IBMer.

Required Technical And Professional Expertise

  • Willingness to complete the requirements of the apprenticeship program
  • 0 - 2 years work experience in a customer-oriented role

Preferred Technical And Professional Experience

  • Some basic knowledge or experience in the following is preferred:
  • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Business systems analysis
  • Lean Six Sigma (Yellow, Green or Black Belts)
  • Basic knowledge of Information Technology Delivery methods
  • Familiarity or use of statistical analysis tools such as Minitab, SPSS
  • Any scripting or programming experience is a plus
  • Familiarity with HR/IT systems and HR business processes.
  • Experienced with Integrations, documentation of technical specification
  • Understanding of the software development cycle

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

descriptionHtml:
Join our team as a Data Analyst where you'll drive impactful decisions through data insights and financial modeling. This role offers the opportunity to work on-site in Bellevue, WA, and contribute to innovative projects in a dynamic environment.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct comprehensive economic, financial, and market analysis to support decision-making processes.
  • Facilitate capacity forecasting, budgeting, and reporting for operating expenses and resource allocation.
  • Design and develop systems and tools to accommodate evolving business needs.
  • Create data models and generate insights using SQL or Python platforms.


Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, with a preference for advanced degrees such as an MBA.
  • Over 7 years of experience in a data analyst capacity, with a focus on handling large datasets.
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL, and Excel is essential.
  • Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to build and manage financial models for forecasting and problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a keen attention to detail.


Preferred Skills

  • Experience with MATLAB and AWS (S3 or similar) platforms.
  • Background in operations or capacity planning.
  • Experience in optimization projects or developing predictive models.
  • Skills in fraud mitigation and defect identification.


At Horizontal, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone is valued and respected. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and join our vibrant team.

Once you apply for this position, you may receive a phone call, SMS or email at the time of application from our Virtual AI Recruiter, Alex, to conduct an initial interview.

Horizontal facilitates valuable and productive conversations between you and potential employers. We can assist you in growing your career by partnering you with employers that offer challenging assignments. For those that join the team, we offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental, vision, and retirement. Check out all we have to offer and how you can become part of the Horizontal Talent Team. The pay range for this role is $32 - $65 per hour. This is not a guarantee of compensation, as final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location.

description: **This is a permanent (FTE) position that will be hired directly by an Insight Global client**Job Description: Master Data Analyst (FTE) - San Francisco, CA You will act as the single owner and subject matter expert for all master data, including but not limited to customer, vendor, chart of accounts, and product data.Own and manage master data across customer, vendor, product, and financial domainsEnsure data integrity through validation rules, quality checks, and cleansing initiativesDefine and enforce data governance policies, metadata standards, and compliance controlsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to align master data with business requirementsAdminister master data systems (Netsuite, Planful, Salesforce, Workiva), including access and configurationSupport system integrations and troubleshoot data quality issues across platformsMaintain accurate data for financial planning and reporting; provide ad-hoc analysis for audits and decision-makingRequired Skills & Experience:Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field.3-5+ years of experience in a data analyst, master data, or data governance role, within a public company.Hands-on experience with Netsuite, and Planful is high preferred, but any FP&A tool will workStrong understanding of financial processes (e.g., Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash) and the impact of master data on financial reporting.Familiarity with financial reporting requirements for public companies (e.g., SOX compliance).Nice to Have Skills & Experience (Not Required)Salesforce and Workia tool experienceSalary Range: $100k - $150k
descriptionHtml:
**This is a permanent (FTE) position that will be hired directly by an Insight Global client**


Job Description: Master Data Analyst (FTE) - San Francisco, CA

You will act as the single owner and subject matter expert for all master data, including but not limited to customer, vendor, chart of accounts, and product data.

  • Own and manage master data across customer, vendor, product, and financial domains
  • Ensure data integrity through validation rules, quality checks, and cleansing initiatives
  • Define and enforce data governance policies, metadata standards, and compliance controls
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align master data with business requirements
  • Administer master data systems (Netsuite, Planful, Salesforce, Workiva), including access and configuration
  • Support system integrations and troubleshoot data quality issues across platforms
  • Maintain accurate data for financial planning and reporting; provide ad-hoc analysis for audits and decision-making


Required Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field.
  • 3-5+ years of experience in a data analyst, master data, or data governance role, within a public company.
  • Hands-on experience with Netsuite, and Planful is high preferred, but any FP&A tool will work
  • Strong understanding of financial processes (e.g., Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash) and the impact of master data on financial reporting.
  • Familiarity with financial reporting requirements for public companies (e.g., SOX compliance).


Nice to Have Skills & Experience (Not Required)

  • Salesforce and Workia tool experience


Salary Range: $100k - $150k
sector: Technology, Information and Media, Computers and Electronics Manufacturing, and Computer Hardware Manufacturing
title: Master Data Analyst

description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.BenefitsThis is a full-time or part-time REMOTE positionYou’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work onYou can work on your own scheduleProjects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume workResponsibilitiesGive AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputsEvaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performanceQualificationsFluency in English (native or bilingual level)Detail-orientedExperience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflowsA current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not requiredNotesPayment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

#coder

descriptionHtml:
About Us

Summit Line Construction, a subsidiary of Quanta Services, Inc. (NYSE: PWR), is one of North America's premier utility construction companies. Headquartered in Heber City, Utah, we offer powerline and substation construction and maintenance services in a variety of utility markets. Like many Quanta operating companies, Summit Line continues to experience significant growth. As our national operations expand, we seek motivated individuals to join the team!

Company Overview

 About this Role

Summit Line Construction is headquartered in Heber City, Utah with additional Utah locations in Sandy and Provo. You can also find us in Northern California, Reno, Las Vegas and Phoenix. We offer our team members competitive pay and benefits, rewarding work, growth opportunities, and a constructive and collaborative work environment.

Position Overview

We are currently seeking a Jr. Data Analyst to join our Utah team! The Jr. Data Analyst, works as a liaison between operations and department heads to develop and maintain data reporting across multiple business platforms to achieve overall business strategies. This role will work closely with the team leads and other team members in several departments to support and implement new systems, building reports and dashboards in Power BI, Excel, and potentially other platforms. This role will also assist with critical business systems integrations and various projects to ensure business leaders, support staff, and field personnel have the tools and information needed to make decisions with increased efficiency.

  • This position is required to report out of our Heber or Provo, UT offices and we are not offering any relocation assistance or incentives for this position at this time. This is not a remote or hybrid position.

What You'll Do

 Key Responsibilities:

Reporting and Dashboards

  • Assist with creating and maintaining business-critical reports and Power BI dashboards.
  • Produce and maintain functional and technical documentation for platform reporting/dashboards.
  • Generate, organize, and report monthly reporting packets for organizational leadership.

Data Integration

  • Assist with various application data integrations utilizing corporate-sponsored and approved integration tools and platforms.
  • Assist with developing and implementing strategies regarding holistic data management.

Expectations

  • Deliver accurate, timely, and actionable reports to support business strategies and decision-making.
  • Maintain thorough and accurate documentation of reporting systems and integrations.
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement new systems and processes.
  • Support continuous improvement efforts through data-driven insights.

What You'll Bring

 Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree in Data Analytics, Business Management, or a related field required.
  • Minimum 1-2 years of experience working in data analytics.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong Microsoft Excel skills; experience working with SQL, Power BI, and large datasets; knowledge of scripting, coding, and application software.
  • Demonstrated ability to organize information and processes logically and efficiently; high attention to detail.

Desired Experience

  • Knowledge and/or experience supporting HCSS Suite of Applications.
  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI.
  • Experience with API integrations.
  • Experience with JD Edwards ERP.
  • Experience working in the construction industry.

Benefits

 What You'll Get

We offer an extremely competitive and comprehensive benefits package including:

  • PTO that starts accruing DAY 1
  • 401K Immediate Vesting; employer match starting same day
  • Several medical plans to choose from
  • Dental Plan and Vision Plan
  • Life insurance, short term & long-term disability
  • Paid Holidays
  • Pet Insurance
  • Employee discounts, EAP and Wellness Program
  • Identity Theft Protection and so much more!

#SLC_LP

Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and/or gender identity), age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, and/or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

We prohibit all types of discrimination and are committed to providing access and equal opportunity for individuals with disabilities. For additional information or if reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application, interview, or hiring processes or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us the Company’s Human Resources department.
title: Junior Data Analyst

description: Who We AreZeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.THE ROLE Zeta Global is seeking a detail-oriented, data-driven Senior Analyst to join our ZX Data Science & Analytics team. If you excel at data storytelling and pride yourself on being a trusted analytics partner to clients, driving optimal outcomes, we want you on our team. You should have a good foundation in marketing measurement, advanced analytics, optimizations, A/B & multivariate testing, as well as a good understanding of machine learning models and other complex data analysis techniques. This position will report to the Manager/Director of Analytics.ResponsibilitiesServe as a trusted analytics partner to Zeta’s clients, focusing on improving their ROI and market share. Utilize data and insights to drive campaign measurement, prescriptive optimizations, and develop a path to consistent performance that exceeds client expectations. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Sales, Account Management, Operations) to establish repeatable frameworks for actionable insights. Monitor trends in customer behavior, segment performance, and market dynamics to identify opportunities. Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations that communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Assist in the development and deployment of state-of-the-art predictive and self-adjusting ML models to significantly enhance campaign performance. Requirements Client-facing experience and excellent communication/presentation skills are essential, as the effectiveness of analysis findings hinges on your ability to present them in a clear and organized manner. Exceptional attention to detail with strong problem-solving and organizational skills. Strong technical expertise in SQL, data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau), and Python is necessary. Familiarity with marketing platforms and data environments. Proven ability to implement statistical analysis and/or predictive modeling techniques, with the capability to effectively translate technical analyses for a business audience. BS in MIS, Analytics / Operations Research / Statistics, or similar quantitative disciplines with 6+ years of experience, or MS degree in these disciplines with 2+ years of experience.  This is a remote role based out of the United States.Benefits & PerksUnlimited PTOExcellent medical, dental, and vision coverageEmployee EquityEmployee Discounts, Virtual Wellness Classes, and Pet Insurance And more!!Compensation Range The compensation range for this role is $110,000 - $130,000 depending on location and experience.  PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETAZeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/ZETA IN THE NEWS!https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases
descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a detail-oriented, data-driven Senior Analyst to join our ZX Data Science & Analytics team. If you excel at data storytelling and pride yourself on being a trusted analytics partner to clients, driving optimal outcomes, we want you on our team. You should have a good foundation in marketing measurement, advanced analytics, optimizations, A/B & multivariate testing, as well as a good understanding of machine learning models and other complex data analysis techniques. This position will report to the Manager/Director of Analytics.

Responsibilities

  • Serve as a trusted analytics partner to Zeta’s clients, focusing on improving their ROI and market share.
  • Utilize data and insights to drive campaign measurement, prescriptive optimizations, and develop a path to consistent performance that exceeds client expectations.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Sales, Account Management, Operations) to establish repeatable frameworks for actionable insights.
  • Monitor trends in customer behavior, segment performance, and market dynamics to identify opportunities.
  • Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations that communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Assist in the development and deployment of state-of-the-art predictive and self-adjusting ML models to significantly enhance campaign performance.

Requirements 

  • Client-facing experience and excellent communication/presentation skills are essential, as the effectiveness of analysis findings hinges on your ability to present them in a clear and organized manner.
  • Exceptional attention to detail with strong problem-solving and organizational skills.
  • Strong technical expertise in SQL, data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau), and Python is necessary.
  • Familiarity with marketing platforms and data environments.
  • Proven ability to implement statistical analysis and/or predictive modeling techniques, with the capability to effectively translate technical analyses for a business audience.
  • BS in MIS, Analytics / Operations Research / Statistics, or similar quantitative disciplines with 6+ years of experience, or MS degree in these disciplines with 2+ years of experience.

 

This is a remote role based out of the United States.

Benefits & Perks

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Employee Equity
  • Employee Discounts, Virtual Wellness Classes, and Pet Insurance And more!!

Compensation Range 

The compensation range for this role is $110,000 - $130,000 depending on location and experience.  

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases
title: Senior Analyst

description: About Us:American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.Job Overview:As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.Key Responsibilities:Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.Qualifications:Master’s degree.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.Preferred Qualifications:Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).What We Offer:Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.Work Authorization Support:H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.Equal Opportunity Commitment:ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.
descriptionHtml:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.


Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
  • Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
  • Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.


Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
  • Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.
  • Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).


What We Offer:

  • Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.
  • Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.


Work Authorization Support:

  • H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
  • Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.


Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.
title: Data Analyst

description: US citizens, Green Card Holders, and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor H1B candidates at this timeJob Title: Sr Data AnalystLocation: New Haven, CT(Hybrid)Duration: 6+Months Job Description: Enhancing existing, as well as developing new descriptionHtml:
US citizens, Green Card Holders, and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor H1B candidates at this time


Job Title: Sr Data Analyst

Location: New Haven, CT(Hybrid)

Duration: 6+Months


Job Description:

  • Enhancing existing, as well as developing new predictive analytics work product, visualizations, and workflows to analyze complex business issues, offering actionable insights and solutions for driving operational enhancements and enterprise growth through strategic data-driven decisions.
  • Identifying and enhancing valuable data sources (within the organization and externally) through the enrichment of existing in-house data with third-party data sources.
  • Communicating insights through the development and implementation of data visualizations, dashboards, and reports for internal and external use.
  • Collaborating with Department managers, IT, IT Security, Data Warehouse, vendors, and contractors about enterprise and departmental data needs.
  • Remaining current on new analytical trends, practices, technologies, and solutions, where appropriate, to ensure their timely introduction for competitive advantage.
  • Grow a culture of data analytics by providing training, awareness, and other events such as “data days” for employees in the business whose duties encompass data and analytics.
  • Meeting with stakeholders and making communication easy and transparent regarding project issues and decisions.

Skills Qualifications

  • Analyze, interpret, and present data using industry-relevant software, i.e., Snowflake, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, ArcGIS, or other industry software.
  • Effective oral and written skills.
  • Being comfortable talking about technical matters with businesspeople and business matters with technical people.
  • Demonstrated success at getting buy-in for ideas with a demonstrated affinity for metrics.
  • Excellent team-building, motivating, and conflict-resolving qualities.
  • Ability to manage key customer relationships, including senior managers.
  • Ability to analyze information to find trends or diagnose problem areas.
  • Be decisive – ownership of the data gathered and the ability to make informed, critical decisions quickly.
  • Experience executing corporate-wide initiatives: defined project plans, coordinated resources, managed implementation activities, and developed all processes associated with program rollout and ongoing support.

Education

  • Education: BS or BA required. An advanced degree in Business, Data, Statistics, or a field related to the essential duties of the position is preferred.
  • Experience:
  • 5-7 years of experience in data modeling, analysis, and understanding of relevant business and data requirements.
  • Record of business process improvement using data and statistical analysis
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills to work with both business and technical partners
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct statistical or mathematical modeling

A reasonable, good-faith estimate of the minimum and maximum for this position is $60/Hr to $70/Hr with Limited benefits
title: Sr Data Analyst

description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.BenefitsThis is a full-time or part-time REMOTE positionYou’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work onYou can work on your own scheduleProjects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume workResponsibilitiesGive AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputsEvaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performanceQualificationsFluency in English (native or bilingual level)Detail-orientedExperience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflowsA current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not requiredNotesPayment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Location: Remote

Duration: long term contract

Payrange : $55 - $60/hr

Benefits for Eligible Employees - Health Insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays.

About Edify :

Headquartered in Naperville, IL, we are a dynamic team with over two decades of industry expertise, dedicated to delivering robust business solutions, staff augmentation, and a comprehensive range of application and web services. Recognized as one of INC. Magazine's Fastest Growing Private Companies, we're committed to empowering businesses with innovative technology solutions.

At Edify Technologies, we partner with customers globally, empowering them to enhance their technology footprint, reduce unnecessary costs, develop sustainable IT solutions, and gain a competitive edge in today's digital world. We believe in creating an impact through innovation, driving tangible results that propel businesses forward.

Job Description:


Minimum Qualification:

  • 8- 15 years of Experience in Azure and Power Platform
  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field


Required Skills: Business Intelligence Analyst - (Power Platform/ Power BI / Power Automate, Azure Blob Storage, RBAC, Azure Services, Azure SQL, Power BI, Power Automate, Sharepoint and Python)


Certifications (Preferred): DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure (or) DP-300: Administering Relational Databases on Microsoft Azure


We Believe in Diversity & Inclusion:

As a minority-owned company, we deeply value and prioritize inclusion and diversity within our organization. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce fosters innovation, creativity, and empathy, leading to a richer and more rewarding work environment. We are committed to cultivating a workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives and talents. Join us and be a part of a team that celebrates diversity, cherishes different perspectives, and fosters a collaborative and supportive community.

descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.
