description: About Us:American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.Job Overview:As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.Key Responsibilities:Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.Qualifications:Master’s degree.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.Preferred Qualifications:Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).What We Offer:Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.Work Authorization Support:H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.Equal Opportunity Commitment:ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.
descriptionHtml:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.


Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
  • Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
  • Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.


Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
  • Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.
  • Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).


What We Offer:

  • Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.
  • Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.


Work Authorization Support:

  • H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
  • Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.


Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.
title: Data Analyst

description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.BenefitsThis is a full-time or part-time REMOTE positionYou’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work onYou can work on your own scheduleProjects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume workResponsibilitiesGive AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputsEvaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performanceQualificationsFluency in English (native or bilingual level)Detail-orientedExperience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflowsA current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not requiredNotesPayment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

descriptionHtml:
Career Area

Technology, Digital and Data

Job Description

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Caterpillar’s Construction Industries Services Division (CISD) division is hiring a Business Intelligence Analyst.

Role Summary: In this role you will support business partners across CISD with data solutions that support our strategy including delivering timely monthly reporting, building custom dashboards, performing data analysis, and completing ad hoc data requests. Join our highly collaborative global team in a fast-paced environment for an opportunity to utilize a variety of skills to make an impact.

What You’ll Do (Job Duties)

  • Highly proficient using SQL to query data
  • Build dashboards using Tableau or Power BI
  • Capture and document customer requirements for requests
  • Translate business needs into technical solutions and explain technical limitations to non-technical customers
  • Analyze data sets to identify insights and communicate findings to business partners
  • Work with cross-functional partners to build solutions
  • Maintain strong relationships with business partners

What You Have (Core Skills)

  • Accuracy and attention to detail in data validation and visualization processes; able to review logic between multiple sources to recognize anomalies and recommend corrective action
  • Effective communication with business partners to understand and clarify requests as well as present to stakeholders
  • Business data analysis to understand the importance and impact of the various metrics on business decisions
  • Technical writing/documentation to enable collaboration and knowledge sharing within the team

Top Candidates Will Also Have

  • SQL and Python experience
  • Power BI or Tableau experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science/Analytics/Related field
  • Knowledge of Caterpillar data sources and access methods
  • Strong customer focus and awareness of company products and service offerings
  • Ability to build a dashboard from concept to production independently
  • Proven track record managing multiple assignments with varied deadlines
  • Able to collaborate with global team and work successfully in a complex matrix environment

Additional Details

  • Work location: Peoria, IL or Irving, TX
  • Visa sponsorship is NOT available for this role
  • Travel: 10%
  • This position requires 5 days per week in the office (M-F)

Summary Pay Range

$95,640.00 - $143,520.00

Compensation and benefits offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, job level, market location, job-related knowledge, skills, individual performance and experience. Please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Caterpillar.

Benefits

Subject to plan eligibility, terms, and guidelines. This is a summary list of benefits.

  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits*
  • Paid time off plan (Vacation, Holidays, Volunteer, etc.)*
  • 401(k) savings plans*
  • Health Savings Account (HSA)*
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)*
  • Health Lifestyle Programs*
  • Employee Assistance Program*
  • Voluntary Benefits and Employee Discounts*
  • Career Development*
  • Incentive bonus*
  • Disability benefits
  • Life Insurance
  • Parental leave
  • Adoption benefits
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • These benefits also apply to part-time employees

This position requires working onsite five days a week.

Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.

Posting Dates

September 22, 2025 - October 5, 2025

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Including Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community.

title: Data Analyst

description: This role sits within the Fixed Income, Securitized Products Group at Brokerage, supporting US sales and trading, secured lending, and capital markets businesses through the Data Analytics team. The position is responsible for managing, analyzing, and reporting data across residential mortgage and other asset-backed transactions to support trading, financing, securitization, and regulatory reporting functions. Key responsibilities include handling data for loan purchases, sales, exits, warehouse financing, and securitizations, while ensuring accuracy through validation, scrubbing, and quality control. The role requires strong quantitative and analytical skills, advanced Excel and modeling proficiency, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive under pressure while managing multiple priorities. Preferred skills include familiarity with mortgage terms, CAS software, PowerPoint, and Power BI, along with excellent communication, organizational, and presentation abilities.

title: Data Analyst

description: Job SummaryWe are seeking a highly analytical and business-focused Sales Analyst to join our team. This role is pivotal in enabling data-driven decision-making across our sales organization by combining strong technical skills in reporting and visualization with a keen understanding of sales performance and market dynamics. The Sales Analyst will be responsible for building and maintaining dashboards (e.g., Power BI), conducting in-depth data analysis, and delivering actionable insights that improve forecasting accuracy, identify growth opportunities, and optimize revenue performance. The ideal candidate will bring a balance of technical expertise and business acumen, enabling them to transform complex data into clear recommendations that drive sales strategy, improve customer engagement, and support overall business growth. Core Responsibilities (Day-to-Day)Sales Data Analysis & ReportingDevelop and maintain sales performance metrics and KPIs (pipeline health, revenue, win rates, quota attainment).Conduct in-depth analysis of sales data to identify trends, patterns, and growth opportunities.Support ad-hoc reporting requests to answer critical sales and business questions.Build and maintain dashboards in Power BI that provide clear and actionable insights for sales leadership.Use SQL to extract, clean, and transform sales, customer, and revenue data.Customer & Market InsightsSegment customers and accounts to identify high-value groups, purchasing behaviors, and retention drivers.Analyze sales performance by customer type, product category, channel, and territory.Provide insight into customer lifecycle and churn risks and identify opportunities to expand share of wallet.Insight Generation & CommunicationTranslate data into actionable recommendations for sales, marketing, ecommerce, and operations teams.Deliver clear, concise reports and presentations to influence decision-making at the leadership level.Dashboard Development & MaintenanceDesign and maintain interactive dashboards to track KPIs.Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and timely updates in all reporting tools.Advanced proficiency in Python to extract, clean, and transform revenue and customer data for analysis. Advanced / Preferred ResponsibilitiesUse Python to automate data extraction, cleaning, and advanced analytics where SQL and BI tools are insufficient.Build predictive or forecasting models to anticipate sales trends, customer churn, and territory performance.Conduct cluster or advanced segmentation analyses to uncover deeper patterns in customer and sales data.Partner with sales leadership to refine incentive programs, territory design, and resource allocation using data-driven insights.Recommend and implement process improvements that make sales reporting and analytics more scalable, repeatable, and efficient.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.3+ years of experience in a data analysis or marketing analytics role.Advanced proficiency in Power BI, SQL, Python and statistical tools/ packages.Advanced Excel skills, including data manipulation, pivot tables, pivot charts, and data modeling.Experience in customer segmentation, cluster analysis, and statistical modeling.Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically.Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a cross-functional team.Join our team and help shape the future of Banner Solutions through innovative strategies and impactful initiatives. If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering actionable insights, drive business growth, and are eager to make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!
descriptionHtml:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly analytical and business-focused Sales Analyst to join our team. This role is pivotal in enabling data-driven decision-making across our sales organization by combining strong technical skills in reporting and visualization with a keen understanding of sales performance and market dynamics. The Sales Analyst will be responsible for building and maintaining dashboards (e.g., Power BI), conducting in-depth data analysis, and delivering actionable insights that improve forecasting accuracy, identify growth opportunities, and optimize revenue performance. The ideal candidate will bring a balance of technical expertise and business acumen, enabling them to transform complex data into clear recommendations that drive sales strategy, improve customer engagement, and support overall business growth.


Core Responsibilities (Day-to-Day)

  • Sales Data Analysis & Reporting
  • Develop and maintain sales performance metrics and KPIs (pipeline health, revenue, win rates, quota attainment).
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of sales data to identify trends, patterns, and growth opportunities.
  • Support ad-hoc reporting requests to answer critical sales and business questions.
  • Build and maintain dashboards in Power BI that provide clear and actionable insights for sales leadership.
  • Use SQL to extract, clean, and transform sales, customer, and revenue data.


Customer & Market Insights

  • Segment customers and accounts to identify high-value groups, purchasing behaviors, and retention drivers.
  • Analyze sales performance by customer type, product category, channel, and territory.
  • Provide insight into customer lifecycle and churn risks and identify opportunities to expand share of wallet.


Insight Generation & Communication

  • Translate data into actionable recommendations for sales, marketing, ecommerce, and operations teams.
  • Deliver clear, concise reports and presentations to influence decision-making at the leadership level.


Dashboard Development & Maintenance

  • Design and maintain interactive dashboards to track KPIs.
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and timely updates in all reporting tools.
  • Advanced proficiency in Python to extract, clean, and transform revenue and customer data for analysis.


Advanced / Preferred Responsibilities

  • Use Python to automate data extraction, cleaning, and advanced analytics where SQL and BI tools are insufficient.
  • Build predictive or forecasting models to anticipate sales trends, customer churn, and territory performance.
  • Conduct cluster or advanced segmentation analyses to uncover deeper patterns in customer and sales data.
  • Partner with sales leadership to refine incentive programs, territory design, and resource allocation using data-driven insights.
  • Recommend and implement process improvements that make sales reporting and analytics more scalable, repeatable, and efficient.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in a data analysis or marketing analytics role.
  • Advanced proficiency in Power BI, SQL, Python and statistical tools/ packages.
  • Advanced Excel skills, including data manipulation, pivot tables, pivot charts, and data modeling.
  • Experience in customer segmentation, cluster analysis, and statistical modeling.
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
  • Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a cross-functional team.


Join our team and help shape the future of Banner Solutions through innovative strategies and impactful initiatives. If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering actionable insights, drive business growth, and are eager to make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!
title: Power BI Analyst

description: About WillHire: WillHire is an innovative talent solutions platform committed to connecting businesses with exceptional candidates. As part of our expansion into Data Analytics, we’re offering a structured internship program for motivated individuals eager to build a career in data-driven decision-making. Internship Summary: Join our analytics team and gain practical experience working on real business datasets. You’ll develop dashboards, conduct data analysis, and help generate actionable insights that contribute to business growth in a dynamic tech environment. Key Responsibilities: Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and usabilityConduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends and patternsCreate interactive and visually compelling dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or ExcelPerform SQL queries and support basic statistical analysesMaintain comprehensive documentation of processes and workflows to ensure data reliability Ideal Candidate Profile: Current student or recent graduate in fields such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or Business AnalyticsProficient with Excel or Google Sheets, SQL, and basic programming skills (Python or R)Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and keen attention to detail Additional Advantages: Familiarity with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)Exposure to cloud platforms, machine learning concepts, or participation in hackathonsRelevant industry certifications (e.g., Google Data Analytics Certificate, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate) What You Will Gain: Real-world project experience and structured mentorshipPersonalized one-on-one guidance from industry professionalsInternship Completion Certificate and Letter of RecommendationOpportunity for pre-placement offer (PPO) based on performance Selection Process: Online Application SubmissionAptitude AssessmentTechnical & Managerial InterviewsOffer Confirmation & Onboarding Note: This is a paid internship opportunity. WillHire is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity, welcoming applications from all qualified candidates regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, or other protected status.
descriptionHtml:
About WillHire:

WillHire is an innovative talent solutions platform committed to connecting businesses with exceptional candidates. As part of our expansion into Data Analytics, we’re offering a structured internship program for motivated individuals eager to build a career in data-driven decision-making.

Internship Summary:

Join our analytics team and gain practical experience working on real business datasets. You’ll develop dashboards, conduct data analysis, and help generate actionable insights that contribute to business growth in a dynamic tech environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and usability
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends and patterns
  • Create interactive and visually compelling dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Excel
  • Perform SQL queries and support basic statistical analyses
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation of processes and workflows to ensure data reliability

Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • Current student or recent graduate in fields such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or Business Analytics
  • Proficient with Excel or Google Sheets, SQL, and basic programming skills (Python or R)
  • Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and keen attention to detail

Additional Advantages:

  • Familiarity with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
  • Exposure to cloud platforms, machine learning concepts, or participation in hackathons
  • Relevant industry certifications (e.g., Google Data Analytics Certificate, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate)

What You Will Gain:

  • Real-world project experience and structured mentorship
  • Personalized one-on-one guidance from industry professionals
  • Internship Completion Certificate and Letter of Recommendation
  • Opportunity for pre-placement offer (PPO) based on performance

Selection Process:

  1. Online Application Submission
  2. Aptitude Assessment
  3. Technical & Managerial Interviews
  4. Offer Confirmation & Onboarding

Note:

This is a paid internship opportunity. WillHire is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity, welcoming applications from all qualified candidates regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, or other protected status.
title: Data Analytics Intern

description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for CAI. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Data Analyst Intern

Req Number

R6105

Employment Type

Full time

Worksite Flexibility

Remote

Who We Are

CAI is a global technology services firm with over 8,500 associates worldwide and a yearly revenue of $1 billion+. We have over 40 years of excellence in uniting talent and technology to power the possible for our clients, colleagues, and communities. As a privately held company, we have the freedom and focus to do what is right-whatever it takes. Our tailor-made solutions create lasting results across the public and commercial sectors, and we are trailblazers in bringing neurodiversity to the enterprise.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will work within our technical data analytics team, focusing on analyzing existing customer data. You will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to discover patterns and insights that will help drive business strategies and improve customer experiences.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team and contribute to impactful data analysis projects. This role is a ? full-time internship role and is remote . The internship dates are June 1, 2026 to July 31 2026.

This internship is a full-time opportunity requiring a commitment of 40 hours per week. Candidates must be available during core business hours (8:30 am EST to 5:00 pm EST) for the entire 9-week duration of the program. Please note that all work must be performed within the United States. This position does not offer work authorization sponsorship now or in the future. Candidates requiring sponsorship will not be considered.

What You'll Do

  • Assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable analytics
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
  • Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to identify trends and patterns in customer data
  • Support the team in ad hoc analysis and reporting requests

What You'll Need

Required

  • Current Junior pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Minimum GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data patterns and trends
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Familiarity with data analytics tools and techniques
  • Passion for working with data and a keen interest in customer data analysis

Preferred

  • Understanding data engineering, data warehousing, and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with Python, Java, or Scala
  • Familiarity with Azure data storage
  • Exposure to data storage technologies such as SQL databases, NoSQL databases, and data lakes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure,) and related data services

Physical Demands ?

  • Ability to?safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent?with the ADA and other federal,?state,?and local standards?
  • Sedentary work that involves sitting or?remaining?stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.?
  • Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer,?utilizing?a mouse, keyboard, and monitor?

The pay for this position is $20 per hour (USD). Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

#DNP

Reasonable accommodation statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employment selection process, please direct your inquiries to application.accommodations@cai.io or (888) 824 - 8111.

The pay range for this position is listed above. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

description: Stanford University has partnered with iHire to reach top talent for their opening below. Check it out and apply via iHireTechnology today!The Department of Radiology at Stanford University is dedicated to excellence in clinical care, research, education, and administration. The people and programs comprising Stanford Radiology are world-renowned. Stanford Radiologys core strength lies in its people: faculty, who are highly regarded for their deep subspecialty expertise, dedication to patient care, and responsiveness to referring providers; multidisciplinary researchers who continue to push the boundaries of innovation in physics and engineering to develop cutting-edge methods for enhanced anatomic and functional imaging; staff who are dedicated and engaged in moving the mission of the department, school, and university forward.The Section of Neuroradiology is seeking a full-time Data Analyst 1 in the Zaharchuk lab which focuses on developing novel Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) techniques to better understand human brain functions, delineate brain structures, and diagnose brain diseases. The data analyst will be involved in defined research projects and will be responsible for independently conducting and analyzing experiments related to neuroimaging technology to neurosciences problems, and independently carrying out analysis to completion. The data analyst is expected to interpret and analyze the results and suggest modifications to procedures as appropriate.Duties include*:Identify and select usable data from subtle and complex data patterns. Assess and produce relevant, standard, or custom information (reports, charts, graphs and tables) from structured data sources by querying data repositories and generating the associated information. Design methods to validate data to ensure high quality product. Explore creative approach to using data based on technical expertise of available data. Distribute reports to applicable agencies, researchers, management and other internal end-users and provide interpretation of data when needed. Develop and produce dashboards, key performance indicators, and other recognized metrics used to monitor and report organizational performance. Collect and analyze metric data.Collect, manage and clean datasets using an extraction and reporting programming language to ensure data integrity. Research and reconcile data discrepancies occurring among various information systems and reports.Collaborate with data managers to define and implement data standards and common data elements for data collection.Identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis and reporting.May test prototype software and participate in approval and release process for new software. - Other duties may also be assigned.Desired QualificationsImage interpretation and manipulation using OSIRIX on Macintosh.Ability to use image processing softwares, including Matlab, ImageJ, FSL, SPM, ITKsnap.Ability to develop Linux-based scripts, program in Python, use of GitHub.Experience with medical imaging datasets.Experience with basic statistics for health sciences.Experience with AI software frameworks, including TensorFlow, pyTorch, and Keras.Education & Experience (required)Bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)Basic knowledge and demonstrated experience using and applying analytical software, database management system software, database reporting software, database user interface and query software, and data mining software.Ability to collect data using a variety of methods, such as data mining and hardcopy or electronic documentation study, to improve or expand databases.Strong listening, verbal and written communication skills.Ability to manage multiple activities in a deadline-oriented environment; highly organized, flexible and rigorous attention to detail.Ability to use logic to calculate data; efficiently construct a database or scrutinize the form of a question.Ability to work with data of varying levels of quality and validity.Demonstrated ability to produce data in a clear and understandable manner meeting user requirements. Ability to work effectively with multiple internal and external customers.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.Frequently sit, sort, file paperwork or parts, grasp lightly, and use fine manipulation, lift, carry, push and pull objects that weigh 10 pounds or less.Occasionally write by hand, twist, bend, stoop and squat.Rarely stand, walk, reach or work above shoulders and use a telephone. - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.Working ConditionsMay work extended hours during peak business cycles.Work StandardsInterpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, .The expected pay range for this position is $82,468.00 to $106,256.00 per annum.Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.At Stanford University, base pay represents only one aspect of the comprehensive rewards package. The Cardinal at Work website ( ) provides detailed information on Stanfords extensive range of benefits and rewards offered to employees. Specifics about the rewards package for this position may be discussed during the hiring process.Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact Stanford University Human Resources by submitting a contact form .Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.
descriptionHtml:
Stanford University has partnered with iHire to reach top talent for their opening below. Check it out and apply via iHireTechnology today!

The Department of Radiology at Stanford University is dedicated to excellence in clinical care, research, education, and administration. The people and programs comprising Stanford Radiology are world-renowned. Stanford Radiologys core strength lies in its people: faculty, who are highly regarded for their deep subspecialty expertise, dedication to patient care, and responsiveness to referring providers; multidisciplinary researchers who continue to push the boundaries of innovation in physics and engineering to develop cutting-edge methods for enhanced anatomic and functional imaging; staff who are dedicated and engaged in moving the mission of the department, school, and university forward.

The Section of Neuroradiology is seeking a full-time Data Analyst 1 in the Zaharchuk lab which focuses on developing novel Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) techniques to better understand human brain functions, delineate brain structures, and diagnose brain diseases. The data analyst will be involved in defined research projects and will be responsible for independently conducting and analyzing experiments related to neuroimaging technology to neurosciences problems, and independently carrying out analysis to completion. The data analyst is expected to interpret and analyze the results and suggest modifications to procedures as appropriate.

Duties include*:

  • Identify and select usable data from subtle and complex data patterns. Assess and produce relevant, standard, or custom information (reports, charts, graphs and tables) from structured data sources by querying data repositories and generating the associated information.
  • Design methods to validate data to ensure high quality product. Explore creative approach to using data based on technical expertise of available data. Distribute reports to applicable agencies, researchers, management and other internal end-users and provide interpretation of data when needed.
  • Develop and produce dashboards, key performance indicators, and other recognized metrics used to monitor and report organizational performance. Collect and analyze metric data.
  • Collect, manage and clean datasets using an extraction and reporting programming language to ensure data integrity.
  • Research and reconcile data discrepancies occurring among various information systems and reports.
  • Collaborate with data managers to define and implement data standards and common data elements for data collection.
  • Identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis and reporting.
  • May test prototype software and participate in approval and release process for new software.
  • - Other duties may also be assigned.

Desired Qualifications

  • Image interpretation and manipulation using OSIRIX on Macintosh.
  • Ability to use image processing softwares, including Matlab, ImageJ, FSL, SPM, ITKsnap.
  • Ability to develop Linux-based scripts, program in Python, use of GitHub.
  • Experience with medical imaging datasets.
  • Experience with basic statistics for health sciences.
  • Experience with AI software frameworks, including TensorFlow, pyTorch, and Keras.

Education & Experience (required)

Bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)

  • Basic knowledge and demonstrated experience using and applying analytical software, database management system software, database reporting software, database user interface and query software, and data mining software.
  • Ability to collect data using a variety of methods, such as data mining and hardcopy or electronic documentation study, to improve or expand databases.
  • Strong listening, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple activities in a deadline-oriented environment; highly organized, flexible and rigorous attention to detail.
  • Ability to use logic to calculate data; efficiently construct a database or scrutinize the form of a question.
  • Ability to work with data of varying levels of quality and validity.
  • Demonstrated ability to produce data in a clear and understandable manner meeting user requirements.
  • Ability to work effectively with multiple internal and external customers.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:

  • Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.
  • Frequently sit, sort, file paperwork or parts, grasp lightly, and use fine manipulation, lift, carry, push and pull objects that weigh 10 pounds or less.
  • Occasionally write by hand, twist, bend, stoop and squat.
  • Rarely stand, walk, reach or work above shoulders and use a telephone.
  • - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

Working Conditions

May work extended hours during peak business cycles.

Work Standards

  • Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
  • Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
  • Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, .

The expected pay range for this position is $82,468.00 to $106,256.00 per annum.

Stanford University provides pay ranges representing its good faith estimate of what the university reasonably expects to pay for a position. The pay offered to a selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal equity, geographic location and external market pay for comparable jobs.

At Stanford University, base pay represents only one aspect of the comprehensive rewards package. The Cardinal at Work website ( ) provides detailed information on Stanfords extensive range of benefits and rewards offered to employees. Specifics about the rewards package for this position may be discussed during the hiring process.

Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact Stanford University Human Resources by submitting a contact form .

Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.BenefitsThis is a full-time or part-time REMOTE positionYou’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work onYou can work on your own scheduleProjects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume workResponsibilitiesGive AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputsEvaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performanceQualificationsFluency in English (native or bilingual level)Detail-orientedExperience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflowsA current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not requiredNotesPayment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

title: Data Analyst

description: Job Title: Data Analyst / Data EngineerSummary:We are seeking a skilled and proactive ETL Developer / Data Engineer to lead the migration of a complex Oracle database to Microsoft SQL Server. This role will also be responsible for enhancing and optimizing the data architecture, improving data flow and collection processes, and supporting analytics and business intelligence initiatives. The ideal candidate has deep experience with both Oracle and MS SQL databases, enjoys solving data challenges, and thrives in building scalable data solutions from the ground up.Primary Responsibilities:Lead the migration of a complex Oracle database to MS SQL Server.Design, maintain, and enhance data architecture across new and existing systems, including data warehouses.Recommend and implement improvements to ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.Develop and maintain ETL pipelines using a variety of tools and technologies.Collaborate with technical and business stakeholders to architect data solutions that meet analytical and operational needs.Conduct thorough ETL and data transformation testing from Oracle to SQL Server to ensure accuracy and integrity.Maintain comprehensive documentation including source-to-target mappings and data flow diagrams.Required Experience:Proven experience developing data warehousing and ETL solutions.Hands-on experience with data integration and transformation processes.Education:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field from an accredited institution.Four years of relevant experience may substitute for the degree requirement.Required Skills:5+ years of advanced SQL development experience, including stored procedures and query optimization.5+ years of experience building data pipelines using ETL tools.Strong proficiency in both Oracle and MS SQL Server, including indexing, performance tuning, and database security.Solid understanding of data warehouse concepts and architecture.Experience with data quality assessment, source system analysis, and business rule validation.Ability to create and interpret source-to-target documentation.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Detail-oriented with a meticulous approach to data management.
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer

Summary:

We are seeking a skilled and proactive ETL Developer / Data Engineer to lead the migration of a complex Oracle database to Microsoft SQL Server. This role will also be responsible for enhancing and optimizing the data architecture, improving data flow and collection processes, and supporting analytics and business intelligence initiatives. The ideal candidate has deep experience with both Oracle and MS SQL databases, enjoys solving data challenges, and thrives in building scalable data solutions from the ground up.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Lead the migration of a complex Oracle database to MS SQL Server.
  • Design, maintain, and enhance data architecture across new and existing systems, including data warehouses.
  • Recommend and implement improvements to ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.
  • Develop and maintain ETL pipelines using a variety of tools and technologies.
  • Collaborate with technical and business stakeholders to architect data solutions that meet analytical and operational needs.
  • Conduct thorough ETL and data transformation testing from Oracle to SQL Server to ensure accuracy and integrity.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation including source-to-target mappings and data flow diagrams.

Required Experience:

  • Proven experience developing data warehousing and ETL solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with data integration and transformation processes.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field from an accredited institution.
  • Four years of relevant experience may substitute for the degree requirement.

Required Skills:

  • 5+ years of advanced SQL development experience, including stored procedures and query optimization.
  • 5+ years of experience building data pipelines using ETL tools.
  • Strong proficiency in both Oracle and MS SQL Server, including indexing, performance tuning, and database security.
  • Solid understanding of data warehouse concepts and architecture.
  • Experience with data quality assessment, source system analysis, and business rule validation.
  • Ability to create and interpret source-to-target documentation.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a meticulous approach to data management.

descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

descriptionHtml:
We are excited to announce a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This fully remote position offers a chance to work on impactful projects within a collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of data mapping details from source systems to target data marts, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
  • Translate business requirements into comprehensive mapping documents and conduct unit testing on datasets.
  • Mentor junior analysts and contribute to their professional growth through training and guidance.
  • Identify and implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and data quality.
  • Provide technical recommendations and insights on new data solutions while adhering to best practices.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including specifications and project artifacts.
  • Engage in collaborative sessions to review mapping and data architecture, ensuring alignment with business needs.


Skills

  • Master’s degree or equivalent experience with a minimum of 5 years in data analytics.
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience with Google Cloud Platform, specifically Big Query.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on detail and quality.
  • Experience working with Agile methodologies and project management tools like Jira and Confluence.


Preferred Skills

  • Experience in the banking or financial services industry, particularly in AML or Fraud analysis.
  • Familiarity with ETL tools such as Ab Initio.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment.


We believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where every individual is valued and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply and join our commitment to equity and inclusion.

Once you apply for this position, you may receive a phone call, SMS or email at the time of application from our Virtual AI Recruiter, Alex, to conduct an initial interview.

Horizontal facilitates valuable and productive conversations between you and potential employers. We can assist you in growing your career by partnering you with employers that offer challenging assignments. For those that join the team, we offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental, vision, and retirement. Check out all we have to offer and how you can become part of the Horizontal Talent Team. The pay range for this role is $37 - $72 per hour. This is not a guarantee of compensation, as final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location.

descriptionHtml:
Title: Operations Data Analyst

Location: Hybrid onsite in Oakland, CA (2 days per week)

Duration: 12 month contract - extensions expected (W2)


Required Skills & Experience

• BA/BS Degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, Engineering or other related field or equivalent work experience

• 6 years of related work experience

• Familiarity with utility operations

• Advanced skill in Microsoft Excel/Access (complex formulas, graphing, VBA)

• Advanced skill in visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, etc.)

• Advanced skill in writing SQL queries using Oracle or Business Objects

• Strong knowledge of base-SAS and programming language such as Visual Basic, Perl, C

• Strong organizational, prioritization and multi-tasking skills.

• Strong problem-solving skills.

• Influence skills.

• Advanced project management skills to lead cross functional teams.


Nice to Have Skills & Experience


• Experience/knowledge of GIS and/or SAP

• Experience with Copperleaf and/or Foundry

• Masters Degree


Job Description


Evergreen, Insight Global’s Manage Service Division partners with a large local utility company’s Integrated Grid Planning team. Looking for an Operations Data Analyst and the responsibilities would include but aren’t limited to:

• Manages complex data analysis projects with limited supervision on only the most complex projects from initial request to presenting data results ensuring that the project is completed within budget and on-time.

• Designs data analysis to achieve business objectives, process data, analyze data, write clear and concise data findings and tailor communications to specific audiences.

• Creates automated data routines and processes for reporting and data delivery ensuring accurate data manipulation and data cleansing.

• Manages extracting data and transferring the data from databases to various analysts to support operational analysis efforts

• Demonstrates and utilizes broad expertise in data processing and data analysis and applies this knowledge to several different issues.

• Provides new and innovative solutions and recommendations to enhance database(s) with new data sources and improved data processes.

• Develops comprehensive reports and communicates clear, concise, and actionable data analyses for clients.

• Works with Directors and Managers across functions to influence decisions.

• Analyze business data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for operational and strategic improvements.

• Collect, clean, and integrate data from various sources, including SAP, Foundry, GIS, and Copperleaf, to support business operations and asset planning.

• Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau to communicate insights and performance metrics.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify challenges, and translate them into data-driven solutions.

• Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.

• Perform ad hoc analyses and present findings to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable format, including responding to data requests.

• Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance across systems and reporting platforms, supporting best practices in data management.



Compensation: $40.00-50.00/HR
title: Operations Data Analyst

descriptionHtml:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.


Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
  • Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
  • Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.


Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
  • Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.
  • Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).


What We Offer:

  • Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.
  • Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.


Work Authorization Support:

  • H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
  • Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.


Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.

As a turnkey provider, we are dedicated to delivering game-changing technology and exceeding expectations. Our commitment to excellence is embedded in our core values, and we seek individuals who resonate with our values and thrive in our dynamic environment. With diverse teams and a focus on high-performance standards, we are proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work for five consecutive years.DescriptionWe are looking for a student interested in data analysis to join our team of Summer 2026 Interns. Our internships are full-time, paid, and will run from May 18th, through July 31st, 2026. This role will work collaboratively, daily with our Engineering groups. descriptionHtml:
Data Analyst Internship – Summer 2026

Tulsa, OK

About Us

Enovation Controls specializes in complex projects, offering unparalleled expertise and innovative solutions. As a turnkey provider, we are dedicated to delivering game-changing technology and exceeding expectations. Our commitment to excellence is embedded in our core values, and we seek individuals who resonate with our values and thrive in our dynamic environment. With diverse teams and a focus on high-performance standards, we are proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work for five consecutive years.

Description

We are looking for a student interested in data analysis to join our team of Summer 2026 Interns. Our internships are full-time, paid, and will run from May 18th, through July 31st, 2026. This role will work collaboratively, daily with our Engineering groups. The internship assignment is designed to provide the student real-life work experience and training in the day-to-day activities in a manufacturing facility. Our internships are part of our recruiting strategy to attract and retain highly qualified talent.

Key Job Responsibilities

  • Work on assigned projects with support from your mentor/supervisor/team member.
  • Hands-on report writing with Power BI.
  • Supporting data transformations and data analysis in SQL and/or Oracle databases.
  • Soliciting report requirements from business process owners and creating FRDs (Functional Report Documents).
  • Testing reports for accuracy
  • Documentation of reports and/or processes

Education Requirements

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Analytics or related field.
  • Minimum of a 3.0 GPA

Preferred Skills

  • Ability to work effectively with others and meet deadlines and goals in a fast-paced environment.
  • Problem solving skills.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Teams.
  • Understanding of database and/or data warehousing concepts
  • Self-motivated, organized, detail oriented, and self-starter.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

descriptionHtml:
Senior Data Analyst — Utilities & Infrastructure Services (On-site, USA)

We operate in the infrastructure and utility services sector, specializing in dry-utility engineering, construction support, and field operations across municipal and commercial projects. Our analytics team delivers operational insights that reduce outages, optimize crews, and improve asset lifecycle decisions. We are hiring a Senior Data Analyst to work on-site in the USA to translate multi-source operational data into trusted dashboards, forecasts, and action plans.

Role & Responsibilities

  • Lead end-to-end analysis of asset, field-operations, work-order, and project datasets to identify trends, root causes, and cost-saving opportunities.
  • Design, build and maintain robust ETL pipelines and data models using SQL and Python to integrate GIS, SCADA, CMMS, and financial feeds.
  • Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports (Power BI/Tableau) for operations, asset management, and executive stakeholders—deliver clear KPIs and self-service analytics.
  • Collaborate with engineering, operations, and GIS teams to standardize data definitions, improve data quality, and document analytics workflows and metrics.
  • Perform statistical analyses and forecasting (time-series, regression) to enable predictive maintenance, crew-level workload planning, and demand forecasting.
  • Coach and mentor junior analysts, establish analytics best practices, and implement QA processes for reproducible, auditable results.

Skills & Qualifications

Must-Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 5+ years of hands-on data analytics experience.
  • Advanced SQL and strong Python (pandas) skills plus proven experience building dashboards in Power BI or Tableau.
  • Experience working with GIS-enabled datasets and operational/field data (work-orders, CMMS, SCADA), with strong Excel skills for ad-hoc analysis.

Preferred

  • Experience in the utility, construction, or infrastructure sector and familiarity with CMMS (Maximo, Oracle, etc.) or field-service systems.
  • Experience with cloud data platforms (AWS/Azure), orchestration/ETL tools (Airflow, Talend) and predictive modeling for maintenance/workforce planning.

Benefits & Culture Highlights

  • On-site, collaborative environment with direct engagement across operations, engineering, and field teams.
  • Clear career growth path—opportunities to lead analytics initiatives and mentor junior staff.
  • Competitive compensation and a focus on data-driven decision-making that delivers visible operational impact.

Keywords: Senior Data Analyst, utilities analytics, asset management, GIS, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, ETL, CMMS, predictive maintenance, on-site, USA.

Skills: analytics,data,power bi,operations
title: Senior Data Analyst

description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for CAI. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.Data Analyst InternReq NumberR6105Employment TypeFull timeWorksite FlexibilityRemoteWho We AreCAI is a global technology services firm with over 8,500 associates worldwide and a yearly revenue of $1 billion+. We have over 40 years of excellence in uniting talent and technology to power the possible for our clients, colleagues, and communities. As a privately held company, we have the freedom and focus to do what is right-whatever it takes. Our tailor-made solutions create lasting results across the public and commercial sectors, and we are trailblazers in bringing neurodiversity to the enterprise.Job SummaryAs a Data Analyst Intern, you will work within our technical data analytics team, focusing on analyzing existing customer data. You will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to discover patterns and insights that will help drive business strategies and improve customer experiences.Job DescriptionWe are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team and contribute to impactful data analysis projects. This role is a ? full-time internship role and is remote . The internship dates are June 1, 2026 to July 31 2026.This internship is a full-time opportunity requiring a commitment of 40 hours per week. descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for CAI. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Data Analyst Intern

Req Number

R6105

Employment Type

Full time

Worksite Flexibility

Remote

Who We Are

CAI is a global technology services firm with over 8,500 associates worldwide and a yearly revenue of $1 billion+. We have over 40 years of excellence in uniting talent and technology to power the possible for our clients, colleagues, and communities. As a privately held company, we have the freedom and focus to do what is right-whatever it takes. Our tailor-made solutions create lasting results across the public and commercial sectors, and we are trailblazers in bringing neurodiversity to the enterprise.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will work within our technical data analytics team, focusing on analyzing existing customer data. You will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to discover patterns and insights that will help drive business strategies and improve customer experiences.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team and contribute to impactful data analysis projects. This role is a ? full-time internship role and is remote . The internship dates are June 1, 2026 to July 31 2026.

This internship is a full-time opportunity requiring a commitment of 40 hours per week. Candidates must be available during core business hours (8:30 am EST to 5:00 pm EST) for the entire 9-week duration of the program. Please note that all work must be performed within the United States. This position does not offer work authorization sponsorship now or in the future. Candidates requiring sponsorship will not be considered.

What You'll Do

  • Assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable analytics
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
  • Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to identify trends and patterns in customer data
  • Support the team in ad hoc analysis and reporting requests

What You'll Need

Required

  • Current Junior pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Minimum GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data patterns and trends
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Familiarity with data analytics tools and techniques
  • Passion for working with data and a keen interest in customer data analysis

Preferred

  • Understanding data engineering, data warehousing, and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with Python, Java, or Scala
  • Familiarity with Azure data storage
  • Exposure to data storage technologies such as SQL databases, NoSQL databases, and data lakes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure,) and related data services

Physical Demands ?

  • Ability to?safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent?with the ADA and other federal,?state,?and local standards?
  • Sedentary work that involves sitting or?remaining?stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.?
  • Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer,?utilizing?a mouse, keyboard, and monitor?

The pay for this position is $20 per hour (USD). Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

#DNP

Reasonable accommodation statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employment selection process, please direct your inquiries to application.accommodations@cai.io or (888) 824 - 8111.

The pay range for this position is listed above. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.
