If ambiguity is uncomfortable, this may feel bumpy.However, If this sounds like fuel, we’d love to talk!How to apply and what to expect in the interview processOur hiring process is structured as a sequence of steps. Moving forward is based on how well the previous step goes. This helps us stay focused, fair, and respectful of everyone’s time.We will always:Let you know clearly what the next step isShare updates and feedback wherever possibleInvite questions if anything feels unclearNot everyone progresses through every stage. That doesn’t mean you’re not great at what you do. Sometimes it’s about timing, team fit, or simply what we’re looking for at the moment.Step 1: Express Your Interest with a PortfolioIf this sounds like your kind of team and you’re excited to bring your craft to Lateral, we’d love to hear from you.Please send us:A brief note telling us what excites you about this roleYour Portfolio / Links to your work —Essential. This could be URLs, GitHub repos, code snippets, portfolio sites — anything that gives us insight into your craftYour resumeA few tips:Highlight any areas that made your work specialAvoid sharing anything sensitive or proprietaryIf you’re sharing team projects, be sure to highlight your specific contributionsWe’re not looking for perfection — we’re looking for insight into your thinking, creativity, and craft. Just show us your thinking, your process, and what you’re proud of.We review every application with care. If there’s a fit, we’ll reach out to schedule next steps.Step 2: Talent Partner ConversationPurpose: A structured discussion with our People Experience team to delve into your career trajectory, motivations, and alignment with Lateral's values.What to Expect:In-depth questions about your past experiences and decision-making processes.Exploration of your career goals and how they align with the role.Discussion about our company culture, availability, compensation and other logisticsMotivators and demotivators.Your life outside coding.Preparation Tips:Reflect on your career journey and pivotal moments.Be ready to discuss challenges you've overcome and lessons learned.Familiarize yourself with the Job Description, Lateral's mission and values.Step 3: Technical interviewPurpose: Assess your technical proficiency and problem-solving abilities.Format: A collaborative session with our engineering team, focusing on real-world scenarios relevant to the role.What to Expect:Problem-solving exercises/questions that mirror tasks you'd encounter in the position.Discussions around your approach, reasoning, and solutions.Preparation Tips:Practice articulating your thought process clearly and concisely.Be prepared to discuss in depth past projects and the technologies used.Step 4: Operational interviewPurpose: Understand your approach to prioritizing, collaborating, shipping, and iterating.What to expect:How you prioritize and break down work.How you collaborate across disciplines.How you handle blockers, feedback, and iteration.Preparation Tips:Pick 1-2 meaningful projects you led or heavily contributed to.Walk through your process: what worked, what didn’t, what you’d do differently.Think about how you manage time, scope, and changing requirements.Step 6: Reference ChecksPurpose: We believe references are about understanding, not just validation. We do not look for perfection, but to understand patterns, strengths, and context. These are often: former managers, senior peers or collaborators, mentors or people you've mentored.What we ask: We focus on how you’ve grown, where you shine, how you like to be led, and what support sets you up for success. We want practical advice for making this a great fit for you.Yes, we do backchannels too: We do this when we feel we need more context. We encourage candidates to engage actively, ask questions, and view this as a two-way exploration.Join us and let’s build something extraordinary.
descriptionHtml:
Lateral stands for technology excellence.

We’re a profitable, award-winning design and technology company with over 20 years of experience launching bold ventures and transforming businesses. A globally distributed team of 200+ experts united by a shared purpose: the continuous pursuit of quality.

Our clients come to us for results, quality and craft - and stay because we keep raising the bar.

We do things differently at Lateral

Our mission is simple: design and build great products.

What sets us apart isn’t just the talent of our team - it’s the way we work:

We Have A Bias For Action & Results.

We are doers - we spot the gaps, connect the dots, anticipate what’s around the corner and take action. We move fast, stay focused, and let the results - not the effort - speak for themselves.

We Work On Time, On Budget, On Quality

Discipline is our edge - a commitment we make to each other, to our clients, and to the standards we hold ourselves to

We Care Deeply.

We care about our work and about each other. Care Is A Competitive Advantage.

Every detail matters. Every design, every line of code, every decision. Thoughtful by default.

We Do Things Right - Because It’s the Right Thing to Do

Right over easy. Integrity isn’t up for negotiation. We hold the bar high even when no one’s watching. We take pride in doing great work the right way - not the easy way.

We Keep Improving

The best teams keep improving and we’re never done learning.

We iterate. We reflect on what’s working and what’s not. Feedback fuels us, we receive it openly, and adapt quickly. Progress over perfection.

We’re Obsessed With Agility, Not The Agile Manifesto

We don’t chase dogma or rituals - we chase momentum. We adapt processes to fit problems, not the other way around.

We Take Ownership

Everyone leads something here. You will have room to run with ideas, and the trust to execute. That trust is built on how you show up: thinking things through, sweating the details, and following through.

What You’ll Do

As a Power BI/Data Analyst at Lateral, you will:

  • Design and Build Dashboards: Create and maintain insightful, visually compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI. You’ll gather requirements from stakeholders and translate business needs into interactive reports that drive decision-making. Expect to iterate on designs and refine visuals to tell clear data stories.
  • Perform Data Modeling & Analytics: Develop robust data models and analytical workflows to support reporting and deeper analysis. This includes shaping and transforming data (using Power Query, SQL, or Python) to ensure reliable, analyzable datasets. You’ll define relationships, calculations, and measures (DAX) that yield accurate insights.
  • Partner with Stakeholders: Work directly with clients and team members to understand key business questions and KPIs. Throughout the full project lifecycle, you’ll translate business needs into data solutions. You will explain your analyses and dashboards clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring insights are understood and actionable.
  • Ensure Data Quality and Integrity: Take ownership of data accuracy end-to-end. You’ll validate and test data, troubleshoot discrepancies, and implement checks so that every report is trusted. Maintain documentation of data definitions and assumptions. At every step, uphold best practices for data governance and security.
  • Optimize and Iterate: Continuously improve the performance and usability of our analytics solutions. You’ll optimize SQL queries and Power BI data models for efficiency, ensuring quick load times and up-to-date data. Incorporate feedback from users to enhance functionality and refine metrics as needs evolve.
  • Contribute to Data Strategy: Look beyond immediate requests to identify new opportunities where data can add value. You might research emerging BI features, propose new analytics methodologies, or develop internal tools to push our data capabilities forward. We expect you to think strategically about how to leverage data for maximum impact.
  • Improve Yourself and the Team: During times you’re not assigned to a client project, you won’t be idle. You might build internal analytics tools, research new technologies or techniques (e.g., a new Azure analytics service or Python library), or help with recruiting and mentoring. You’ll help push our data craft and capabilities forward.
  • Mentor and Share Knowledge: Lead by example in fostering a data-driven culture. You will support junior analysts (formally or informally), offer constructive feedback on their work, and share best practices in data analysis, visualization design, and data storytelling. You’ll help cultivate a thoughtful, kind, and continuously learning team culture.

How We Measure Success In This Role

In the first two weeks

  • You’ve set up all necessary access to databases, Power BI, and Azure resources, and made your first meaningful contribution (for example, fixing a report, creating a simple analysis, or improving an existing dashboard).
  • You communicate well both asynchronously (in writing) and in meetings, asking clarifying questions and sharing updates proactively.

In the first 3 months:

  • You understand our data sources, models, and business domain well, and can work independently (or in small teams) on medium-sized analytics projects.
  • You plan before you build: outlining data requirements or sketching a report design before diving into development (and producing any needed design artifacts or documentation).
  • You have delivered at least one significant dashboard or analysis to production use, with clean implementation and validated results.
  • You communicate clearly, raising issues or data concerns early and contributing thoughtfully to code reviews or design discussions.
  • You consistently deliver on your commitments, meeting deadlines and ensuring your work meets our quality standards.

After 3 months:

  • You take ownership of larger analytical initiatives and improvements from start to finish (for example, leading the development of a new data model or a suite of reports for a major client.)
  • You help others by sharing knowledge, spotting data issues or process gaps early, and proposing improvements to our tools or workflows (perhaps optimizing an ETL process or improving how we organize reports).
  • You make decisions with both data integrity and business goals in mind, balancing technical correctness with actionable insight for the client.

We measure success through:

  • Impact of your work: Evaluating results of what you’ve delivered (are your dashboards and insights driving decisions or improvements?)
  • Quality and reliability of your analyses: The accuracy, consistency, and performance of your data models and reports.
  • Consistency in delivery: Your track record of meeting commitments and delivering value on time.
  • Feedback from peers and leads: Input on your collaboration, communication, and the value you add to projects.
  • Your ability to work independently and unblock others: How well you can move projects forward on your own, and how you help teammates overcome data challenges or confusion.

What We’re Looking For

We are seeking team members who have strong technical skills and who deeply care about their craft and how the work gets done. You must bring:

  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a track record of delivering analytics solutions (dashboards, reports, and data models) from concept to insight.
  • Proficiency in Power BI: hands-on experience building interactive dashboards and reports. You can create effective data visualizations and have strong DAX skills for custom measures and calculations.
  • Advanced SQL skills: able to write and optimize complex queries to manipulate and retrieve data from relational databases. You understand how to join and transform data efficiently, and you’re comfortable with large datasets.
  • Experience with Python for data analysis or automation - you can use libraries (e.g., pandas, numpy) to clean, analyze, or augment data, and script repetitive tasks to streamline workflows.
  • Familiarity with Azure data services: experience integrating or working with cloud data platforms (Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, or similar) to store, transform, or access data is highly valued.
  • High proficiency in Excel: adept with advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis in spreadsheets for quick ad-hoc analysis or data modeling when needed.
  • Strong data modeling and analytical thinking skills: ability to design efficient data schemas (in Power BI or databases), and to interpret data to generate meaningful insights. You think critically about what the numbers are showing and why.
  • Attention to detail and a quality mindset: you ensure accuracy at every step, write test queries or checks to validate results, and have an eye for catching anomalies. You take pride in delivering work that is correct and reliable.
  • Unique combination of technology and people skills. You can dive into technical data problems, but also excel at collaborating with others. You communicate complex data concepts in clear, approachable terms and build trust with clients and teammates alike.
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, paired with a hands-on, proactive attitude. When faced with a data challenge, you eagerly roll up your sleeves to investigate and resolve it.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English. You can document your work, write clear explanations, and present findings or recommendations to stakeholders confidently.
  • A commitment to making a difference, continuous learning, and collaboration. You are driven by impact and improvement, always looking for ways to grow your skills, help your teammates, and contribute to projects that matter.

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with data warehousing or big data tools (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, Hadoop) or advanced analytics platforms.
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis or machine learning techniques to derive deeper insights from data.
  • Relevant certifications such as Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate or Azure Data Engineer/Analyst certifications.
  • Prior consulting or client-facing experience where you had to adapt to different industries or domains quickly.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

  • Real Impact: You’ll work on meaningful products that make a measurable difference - from healthcare and commerce to sustainability and next-gen tech.
  • Remote-First, Office Friendly: Work from wherever you’re most productive - whether that’s your home, a co-working space, or one of our offices. We’re a remote-first company, but if you’re near an office, you’re welcome to drop in, collaborate in person, or work onsite regularly.

We prioritize async collaboration, respect your time zone, and focus on outcomes over hours.

  • An Outstanding Team: Talented, kind, and hard-working people who care deeply about their craft - and about each other. No egos. No politics. Just professionals doing their best work.
  • Growth: You’ll be supported in growing your craft, exploring new paths, and stepping into greater responsibility - at your own pace
  • A Culture of Excellence: We care deeply about doing the right thing - for our clients, our team, and ourselves. No burnout. No crunch. Just high-quality work, delivered sustainably.
  • Variety & Stability: We’re profitable, independent, and over a decade strong. Yet every project brings a fresh challenge. You’ll never be bored here.

This Role Might Not Be for You

We want to respect your time by being clear about what this role isn’t. You should skip this opportunity if:

  • You prefer well defined structure. If you gravitate towards a clear hierarchy, well defined roles and swim lanes, you may find our self-managed style challenging.
  • Distributed work isn’t your thing. If you find async communication, design documentation and being proactive without a manager nearby difficult, our setup won’t suit you.
  • Feedback doesn't excite you. We’re obsessed with quality and believe in continuous improvement. That means we give feedback that’s sometimes nitpicky. If refining the work until it’s excellent feels over the top, you are likely going to find working here frustrating.
  • Change makes you uncomfortable. We’re scaling and maturing. That means not everything is perfect yet. Priorities shift. Processes evolve. If ambiguity is uncomfortable, this may feel bumpy.

However, If this sounds like fuel, we’d love to talk!

How to apply and what to expect in the interview process

Our hiring process is structured as a sequence of steps. Moving forward is based on how well the previous step goes. This helps us stay focused, fair, and respectful of everyone’s time.

We will always:

  • Let you know clearly what the next step is
  • Share updates and feedback wherever possible
  • Invite questions if anything feels unclear

Not everyone progresses through every stage. That doesn’t mean you’re not great at what you do. Sometimes it’s about timing, team fit, or simply what we’re looking for at the moment.

Step 1: Express Your Interest with a Portfolio

If this sounds like your kind of team and you’re excited to bring your craft to Lateral, we’d love to hear from you.

Please send us:

  • A brief note telling us what excites you about this role
  • Your Portfolio / Links to your work —Essential. This could be URLs, GitHub repos, code snippets, portfolio sites — anything that gives us insight into your craft
  • Your resume

A few tips:

  • Highlight any areas that made your work special
  • Avoid sharing anything sensitive or proprietary
  • If you’re sharing team projects, be sure to highlight your specific contributions

We’re not looking for perfection — we’re looking for insight into your thinking, creativity, and craft. Just show us your thinking, your process, and what you’re proud of.

We review every application with care. If there’s a fit, we’ll reach out to schedule next steps.

Step 2: Talent Partner Conversation

Purpose: A structured discussion with our People Experience team to delve into your career trajectory, motivations, and alignment with Lateral's values.

What to Expect:

  • In-depth questions about your past experiences and decision-making processes.
  • Exploration of your career goals and how they align with the role.
  • Discussion about our company culture, availability, compensation and other logistics
  • Motivators and demotivators.
  • Your life outside coding.

Preparation Tips:

  • Reflect on your career journey and pivotal moments.
  • Be ready to discuss challenges you've overcome and lessons learned.
  • Familiarize yourself with the Job Description, Lateral's mission and values.

Step 3: Technical interview

Purpose: Assess your technical proficiency and problem-solving abilities.

Format: A collaborative session with our engineering team, focusing on real-world scenarios relevant to the role.

What to Expect:

  • Problem-solving exercises/questions that mirror tasks you'd encounter in the position.
  • Discussions around your approach, reasoning, and solutions.

Preparation Tips:

  • Practice articulating your thought process clearly and concisely.
  • Be prepared to discuss in depth past projects and the technologies used.

Step 4: Operational interview

Purpose: Understand your approach to prioritizing, collaborating, shipping, and iterating.

What to expect:

  • How you prioritize and break down work.
  • How you collaborate across disciplines.
  • How you handle blockers, feedback, and iteration.

Preparation Tips:

  • Pick 1-2 meaningful projects you led or heavily contributed to.
  • Walk through your process: what worked, what didn’t, what you’d do differently.
  • Think about how you manage time, scope, and changing requirements.

Step 6: Reference Checks

Purpose: We believe references are about understanding, not just validation. We do not look for perfection, but to understand patterns, strengths, and context. We use them to learn how to support you best.

What to Expect: we’ll ask you for 2–3 people who’ve worked closely with you. These are often: former managers, senior peers or collaborators, mentors or people you've mentored.

What we ask: We focus on how you’ve grown, where you shine, how you like to be led, and what support sets you up for success. We want practical advice for making this a great fit for you.

Yes, we do backchannels too: We do this when we feel we need more context. We will check with you if there are folks we should avoid reaching out due to confidentiality or other reasons. And here’s our commitment: if anything surprising or unclear comes up in a backchannel, we’ll bring it directly to you. We believe in “no stories without you in the room.” You’ll always get the chance to share your side, context, or clarification.

Step 7: Offer

What Happens: If selected, you'll receive a comprehensive offer detailing compensation, and other pertinent information.

Our hiring process is designed to be thorough yet respectful, ensuring a mutual fit. We encourage candidates to engage actively, ask questions, and view this as a two-way exploration.

Join us and let’s build something extraordinary.

The position also cross-trains as a backup scheduler to ensure smooth plant operations.ResponsibilitiesGather, validate, and analyze production, downtime, waste, and shrink data.Prepare regular KPI reports and develop dashboards, charts, and trend analyses.Provide insights to help identify root causes and drive process improvements.Track and document progress of waste reduction and efficiency programs.Assist with SOPs, training resources, and 5S/continuous improvement audits.Train in scheduling systems and step in as scheduler when needed.Partner with leadership to maintain accurate schedules and reporting.Measures of SuccessTimely, accurate, and error-free reporting.Reliable data integrity and actionable insights.Documented progress of improvement initiatives.Readiness to provide scheduling support.Qualifications & SkillsStrong Excel and data visualization capabilities.Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.Knowledge of lean and continuous improvement methods.Solid organizational and documentation skills.Effective communicator and team collaborator.Willingness to learn and take on backup operational responsibilities.
descriptionHtml:
Overview

This role supports the Plant Superintendent by delivering accurate production data, tracking KPIs, and analyzing improvement projects. The position also cross-trains as a backup scheduler to ensure smooth plant operations.


Responsibilities

  • Gather, validate, and analyze production, downtime, waste, and shrink data.
  • Prepare regular KPI reports and develop dashboards, charts, and trend analyses.
  • Provide insights to help identify root causes and drive process improvements.
  • Track and document progress of waste reduction and efficiency programs.
  • Assist with SOPs, training resources, and 5S/continuous improvement audits.
  • Train in scheduling systems and step in as scheduler when needed.
  • Partner with leadership to maintain accurate schedules and reporting.


Measures of Success

  • Timely, accurate, and error-free reporting.
  • Reliable data integrity and actionable insights.
  • Documented progress of improvement initiatives.
  • Readiness to provide scheduling support.


Qualifications & Skills

  • Strong Excel and data visualization capabilities.
  • Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.
  • Knowledge of lean and continuous improvement methods.
  • Solid organizational and documentation skills.
  • Effective communicator and team collaborator.
  • Willingness to learn and take on backup operational responsibilities.

You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots complex coding questions and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor’s degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

#coder

descriptionHtml:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.


Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
  • Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
  • Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.


Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
  • Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.
  • Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).


What We Offer:

  • Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.
  • Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.


Work Authorization Support:

  • H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
  • Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.


Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.

descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for CAI. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Data Analyst Intern

Req Number

R6105

Employment Type

Full time

Worksite Flexibility

Remote

Who We Are

CAI is a global technology services firm with over 8,500 associates worldwide and a yearly revenue of $1 billion+. We have over 40 years of excellence in uniting talent and technology to power the possible for our clients, colleagues, and communities. As a privately held company, we have the freedom and focus to do what is right-whatever it takes. Our tailor-made solutions create lasting results across the public and commercial sectors, and we are trailblazers in bringing neurodiversity to the enterprise.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will work within our technical data analytics team, focusing on analyzing existing customer data. You will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to discover patterns and insights that will help drive business strategies and improve customer experiences.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team and contribute to impactful data analysis projects. This role is a ? full-time internship role and is remote . The internship dates are June 1, 2026 to July 31 2026.

This internship is a full-time opportunity requiring a commitment of 40 hours per week. Candidates must be available during core business hours (8:30 am EST to 5:00 pm EST) for the entire 9-week duration of the program. Please note that all work must be performed within the United States. This position does not offer work authorization sponsorship now or in the future. Candidates requiring sponsorship will not be considered.

What You'll Do

  • Assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable analytics
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
  • Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to identify trends and patterns in customer data
  • Support the team in ad hoc analysis and reporting requests

What You'll Need

Required

  • Current Junior pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Minimum GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data patterns and trends
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Familiarity with data analytics tools and techniques
  • Passion for working with data and a keen interest in customer data analysis

Preferred

  • Understanding data engineering, data warehousing, and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with Python, Java, or Scala
  • Familiarity with Azure data storage
  • Exposure to data storage technologies such as SQL databases, NoSQL databases, and data lakes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure,) and related data services

Physical Demands ?

  • Ability to?safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent?with the ADA and other federal,?state,?and local standards?
  • Sedentary work that involves sitting or?remaining?stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.?
  • Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer,?utilizing?a mouse, keyboard, and monitor?

The pay for this position is $20 per hour (USD). Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

#DNP

Reasonable accommodation statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employment selection process, please direct your inquiries to application.accommodations@cai.io or (888) 824 - 8111.

The pay range for this position is listed above. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

description: Yamaha has an excellent opportunity for a Market Intelligence Analyst II to join our Marine team in Kennesaw, GA. This position will be responsible for supporting in-depth market research and competitive analysis. This role requires a keen analytical mind, strong research skills, and the ability to synthesize complex information into actionable insightsWhat you'll be doing:Track, analyze and report the state of the economy and the Marine industry, identifying trends, market opportunities, and potential threats.Conduct comprehensive competitive research using both internal sources (sales and warranty data, sales teams, product teams) and external sources (industry reports, social media, competitor websites, industry analysts, conferences, etc.).Create and maintain competitors’ profiles deep dives.Create and maintain competitor battlecards for product acquired via M&A, that directly impact competitor win rates.Prepare detailed reports and presentations that communicate findings and recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders.Provide organized data in consistent structure for activities such as data visualization, reporting, forecasting and analysis to support strategic planning and executive decision makingCreate and maintain accurate industry forecasts that help the company proactively plan for volume changes.Support marketing, sales, product management and advanced engineering initiatives by sharing insights with those teams.What you need to be successful:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business, marketing, economics, or related field.3-5 year of experience in competitive intelligence, market research, or product marketing.Proficiency with MS Office including advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.Proficiency with data visualization tools (SAP Analytics Cloud, Business Objects, Power BI, Tableau)Basic knowledge of forecasting techniques and tools (R or SPSS knowledge)Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and underrepresented minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Yamaha, we understand that talent comes in various forms, as such we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!What’s in it for you: 401(k) and Profit SharingFertility Benefits37.5 hour work-weekMedical, Dental, VisionLife and AD&D InsuranceWellness ProgramShort-Term Disability Coverage (for hourly roles)Long-Term DisabilityStudent Debt Repayment BenefitsAbility to borrow Yamaha productReports to: Department ManagerYamaha Motor Corporation, USA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, veteran or disability or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees
descriptionHtml:
Yamaha has an excellent opportunity for a Market Intelligence Analyst II to join our Marine team in Kennesaw, GA. This position will be responsible for supporting in-depth market research and competitive analysis. This role requires a keen analytical mind, strong research skills, and the ability to synthesize complex information into actionable insights

What you'll be doing:

  • Track, analyze and report the state of the economy and the Marine industry, identifying trends, market opportunities, and potential threats.
  • Conduct comprehensive competitive research using both internal sources (sales and warranty data, sales teams, product teams) and external sources (industry reports, social media, competitor websites, industry analysts, conferences, etc.).
  • Create and maintain competitors’ profiles deep dives.
  • Create and maintain competitor battlecards for product acquired via M&A, that directly impact competitor win rates.
  • Prepare detailed reports and presentations that communicate findings and recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Provide organized data in consistent structure for activities such as data visualization, reporting, forecasting and analysis to support strategic planning and executive decision making
  • Create and maintain accurate industry forecasts that help the company proactively plan for volume changes.
  • Support marketing, sales, product management and advanced engineering initiatives by sharing insights with those teams.


What you need to be successful:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business, marketing, economics, or related field.
  • 3-5 year of experience in competitive intelligence, market research, or product marketing.
  • Proficiency with MS Office including advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.
  • Proficiency with data visualization tools (SAP Analytics Cloud, Business Objects, Power BI, Tableau)
  • Basic knowledge of forecasting techniques and tools (R or SPSS knowledge)


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and underrepresented minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Yamaha, we understand that talent comes in various forms, as such we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!

What’s in it for you:

  • 401(k) and Profit Sharing
  • Fertility Benefits
  • 37.5 hour work-week
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Wellness Program
  • Short-Term Disability Coverage (for hourly roles)
  • Long-Term Disability
  • Student Debt Repayment Benefits
  • Ability to borrow Yamaha product


Reports to: Department Manager

Yamaha Motor Corporation, USA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, veteran or disability or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

descriptionHtml:
Title: Data Project Manager

Location: Greenwich, NYC (Onsite-Hybrid)

Job Description:

Skills:

  • Technical level delivery experience in Capital Markets, for enterprise systems
  • Data services domain expertise; including data architecture, big data, data warehousing, data controls
  • Proven ability to diagnose problems and cut through ambiguity across data, systems and organizations which include Front Office, Risk and Finance Systems
  • Proven ability to identify/communicate risks and impact, influence and contribute to risk mitigations
  • Proven ability to provide in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define problems, influence strategic functional decisions

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for end-to-end data Solution delivery for a given product area
  • Collaborate closely with various technology and functional teams
  • Provide governance and oversight for the delivery of Consent Order Data Plan
  • Lead and facilitate various aspects of the Enterprise Data Governance Strategy, Data Quality and Reconciliation.
  • Track and deliver to the prioritized scope of regulatory obligations

descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for CAI. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Data Analyst Intern

Req Number

R6105

Employment Type

Full time

Worksite Flexibility

Remote

Who We Are

CAI is a global technology services firm with over 8,500 associates worldwide and a yearly revenue of $1 billion+. We have over 40 years of excellence in uniting talent and technology to power the possible for our clients, colleagues, and communities. As a privately held company, we have the freedom and focus to do what is right-whatever it takes. Our tailor-made solutions create lasting results across the public and commercial sectors, and we are trailblazers in bringing neurodiversity to the enterprise.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will work within our technical data analytics team, focusing on analyzing existing customer data. You will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to discover patterns and insights that will help drive business strategies and improve customer experiences.

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team and contribute to impactful data analysis projects. This role is a ? full-time internship role and is remote . The internship dates are June 1, 2026 to July 31 2026.

This internship is a full-time opportunity requiring a commitment of 40 hours per week. Candidates must be available during core business hours (8:30 am EST to 5:00 pm EST) for the entire 9-week duration of the program. Please note that all work must be performed within the United States. This position does not offer work authorization sponsorship now or in the future. Candidates requiring sponsorship will not be considered.

What You'll Do

  • Assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable analytics
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
  • Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to identify trends and patterns in customer data
  • Support the team in ad hoc analysis and reporting requests

What You'll Need

Required

  • Current Junior pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Minimum GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data patterns and trends
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Familiarity with data analytics tools and techniques
  • Passion for working with data and a keen interest in customer data analysis

Preferred

  • Understanding data engineering, data warehousing, and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with Python, Java, or Scala
  • Familiarity with Azure data storage
  • Exposure to data storage technologies such as SQL databases, NoSQL databases, and data lakes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure,) and related data services

Physical Demands ?

  • Ability to?safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent?with the ADA and other federal,?state,?and local standards?
  • Sedentary work that involves sitting or?remaining?stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.?
  • Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer,?utilizing?a mouse, keyboard, and monitor?

The pay for this position is $20 per hour (USD). Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

#DNP

Reasonable accommodation statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employment selection process, please direct your inquiries to application.accommodations@cai.io or (888) 824 - 8111.

The pay range for this position is listed above. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including location, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role will include medical coverage as well as 401k retirement account access. Employees in this role may also be entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

description: Our non-profit client located in New York is looking for a Jr. Data Engineer to join the their team to complete the following:      Duties and Responsibilities Build, enhance, and manage interactive dashboards and PowerBI reports. Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL workflows and pipelines. Aggregate data from various sources into reliable and robust data and analytic solutions. Implement data quality, consistency, and security, across all platforms—keeping compliance top of mind (think NIST, HIPPA). Use tools like PowerBi, SharePoint, Teams, and Power Automate to streamline report distribution, collaboration, and workflows. Manage Enterprise datasets, gateways, and workspaces, ensuring uptime, performance, and ease of access for users. Create clear, user-friendly documentation to support adoption, training, and long-term scalability. SPECIFIC SKILLS: 3+ years of Power BI expertise (DAX, Power Query/M, Power BI Service) Exposure to Azure Data Services (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, etc.) Proficiency with Office 365 tools (SharePoint, Excel, Teams, Power Automate) Scripting (Python, PowerShell) for automation Familiarity with the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate) Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases (SQL Server, Azure SQL, etc.) Familiarity with data modeling (star schema, normalization, data warehousing concepts) Attention to detail and a passion for clean, actionable data Strong communicator who can translate tech into business value Understanding of data governance and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, GDPR, etc.) CORE COMPETENCIES: Excellent work ethic Commitment to working in a mission-driven organization Demonstrated personal ethics and values Cross-team collaboration and cooperation Team player who works well with a diverse group of people QUALIFICATIONS 5+ years in a Data Engineer, BI Developer, or related role.

description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.BenefitsThis is a full-time or part-time REMOTE positionYou’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work onYou can work on your own scheduleProjects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume workResponsibilitiesGive AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputsEvaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performanceQualificationsFluency in English (native or bilingual level)Detail-orientedExperience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflowsA current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not requiredNotesPayment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.This is an independent contract position.#coder
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position

You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on

You can work on your own schedule

Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

Give AI chatbots coding challenges and evaluate their outputs

Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)

Detail-oriented

Experience with algorithms, data structures, and debugging workflows

A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Only applicants in the United States will be considered for this role.

This is an independent contract position.

As BI Data Analyst you will be responsible for owning reporting, analytics, and data modeling while working directly with executives to answer business questions that drive growth and strategy. In this role you must be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, taking full ownership of projects and building solutions even when requirements aren’t fully defined. The ideal candidate will design dashboards, craft visualizations, and write complex queries that turn raw data into actionable insights. We are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented professional who can communicate clearly with leadership, translate ambiguity into structured solutions, and deliver accurate reporting that supports descriptionHtml:
Position Summary:

Our partner, an innovative company transforming the relocation and travel industry, is seeking a BI Data Analyst to support their leadership team with critical data insights. As BI Data Analyst you will be responsible for owning reporting, analytics, and data modeling while working directly with executives to answer business questions that drive growth and strategy. In this role you must be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, taking full ownership of projects and building solutions even when requirements aren’t fully defined. The ideal candidate will design dashboards, craft visualizations, and write complex queries that turn raw data into actionable insights. We are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented professional who can communicate clearly with leadership, translate ambiguity into structured solutions, and deliver accurate reporting that supports high-visibility decisions.


Experience and Education:

  • BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience/field
  • Background in business intelligence or data analytics within complex data environments
  • Experience building dashboards and advanced reporting in BI platforms, Sisense strongly preferred
  • Hands-on SQL query development, with exposure to scripting for statistical or data manipulation tasks
  • Exposure to ETL setup or data pipeline development
  • Experience working directly with leadership or client-facing teams to interpret business requests into analytics


Skills and Strengths:

  • Open-source BI Tools
  • SQL Queries
  • Python
  • ETL development
  • Data modeling
  • Dashboard design
  • Statistical analysis
  • R
  • Elastic cube configuration
  • Data visualization
  • Business requirements gathering
  • Data validation
  • Complex reporting
  • Communication skills
  • Data analysis
  • Problem solving
  • Executive presentation
  • Analytical thinking
  • Independent project ownership


Primary Job Responsibilities:

  • Build dashboards, reports, and visualizations that translate raw data into actionable insights
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries for analytics and reporting needs
  • Configure and maintain Sisense elastic cubes and other BI datasets
  • Design ETL processes to prepare and structure data for analysis
  • Translate business questions from executives into clear analytical approaches
  • Deliver reporting and analysis that support client needs and internal decision-making
  • Provide statistical analysis using Python, R, or other scripting when needed
  • Validate data accuracy and ensure reporting consistency
  • Present findings to leadership with clarity and precision
  • Identify gaps in data and create new datasets as required
  • Work independently to manage analysis projects from start to finish
  • Partner with leadership to prioritize reporting and analytics requests
  • Ensure BI solutions are scalable, accurate, and business-driven
  • Serve as the in-house subject matter expert for BI tools and practices

description: DescriptionThis is a Hybrid role located in New York, NY.  Office Requirements  : Tuesday-ThursdayAbout UsHello, we’re Flare! We are reimagining how attorneys and clients work together. We are obsessed with building solutions that empower attorneys and consumers through the legal journey. Funded by leading VC firms, we are an industry leader in legal technology. Our platform simplifies the delivery of complex legal services while providing ease and clarity to clients and attorneys throughout the process. With a global team that brings a fresh perspective, Flare is revolutionizing the way legal services are delivered. We’re a team of creative problem-solvers who want to make the world a better place. Join us.Check out helloflare.com for more!OverviewAt Flare, we’re transforming consumer legal services by focusing on the core of human experiences. Our platform isn’t just a service; it’s a belief that legal transactions should be intuitive, empowering, and accessible.This sets us apart in the market and offers a unique chance to reshape how legal services are accessed and experienced.We are looking for an Operations Business Analyst who is passionate about data and has a strong analytical background. We are looking for someone that will drive key data-driven processes and decisions, aimed at uncovering new and existing opportunities for our company. In this role, you will partner closely with our Supply and Client Experience Operations teams to unlock new understanding of what is working and what will drive improvements for the future. You will help our ops teams dive deeper into the trends and be at the forefront of driving clarity and improvements every day that not only help the ops teams know where to focus but also create insights for cross functional teams like product, marketing, etc!RequirementsWhat you'll doPerformance Monitoring & Reporting: Partner with operations teams to define, create, and maintain easy-to-use Tableau dashboards that track key business metrics. Ensure a shared understanding of performance by aligning on metric definitions and logic.Deep-Dive Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis to understand trends and root causes behind performance fluctuations. Provide actionable insights to the supply (attorneys) and client experience teams to improve processes and outcomes. You will be responsible for not only completing the analysis but also helping shape perspectives on what we should be investigating next. You’re not only helping teams through their requested deepdives but also telling them what they are missing and what we should be looking into next to drive impact.Strategic Insight: Translate data into a compelling narrative that informs business strategy and decision-making. Present findings clearly to various stakeholders, from team members to leadership.Who you are:Experience: 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst or in a similar role, preferably within the technology sector.Intellectually curious and hungry for impact: you are motivated by constantly leveling up the status quo. You are always looking for the next place to drive impact and are relentless in your hunt to find the next big unlock for business impactSelf starter and comfortable with autonomy: you never wait for the next assignment - you are self motivated and comfortable working autonomouslyTechnical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, BI platforms like Tableau)Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to dissect complex issues and propose effective solutions.Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.Education: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, or a related discipline
descriptionHtml:
Description

This is a Hybrid role located in New York, NY. Office Requirements : Tuesday-Thursday

About Us

Hello, we’re Flare! We are reimagining how attorneys and clients work together. We are obsessed with building solutions that empower attorneys and consumers through the legal journey. Funded by leading VC firms, we are an industry leader in legal technology. Our platform simplifies the delivery of complex legal services while providing ease and clarity to clients and attorneys throughout the process. With a global team that brings a fresh perspective, Flare is revolutionizing the way legal services are delivered. We’re a team of creative problem-solvers who want to make the world a better place. Join us.

Check out helloflare.com for more!

Overview

At Flare, we’re transforming consumer legal services by focusing on the core of human experiences. Our platform isn’t just a service; it’s a belief that legal transactions should be intuitive, empowering, and accessible.This sets us apart in the market and offers a unique chance to reshape how legal services are accessed and experienced.

We are looking for an Operations Business Analyst who is passionate about data and has a strong analytical background. We are looking for someone that will drive key data-driven processes and decisions, aimed at uncovering new and existing opportunities for our company. In this role, you will partner closely with our Supply and Client Experience Operations teams to unlock new understanding of what is working and what will drive improvements for the future. You will help our ops teams dive deeper into the trends and be at the forefront of driving clarity and improvements every day that not only help the ops teams know where to focus but also create insights for cross functional teams like product, marketing, etc!

Requirements

What you'll do

  • Performance Monitoring & Reporting: Partner with operations teams to define, create, and maintain easy-to-use Tableau dashboards that track key business metrics. Ensure a shared understanding of performance by aligning on metric definitions and logic.
  • Deep-Dive Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis to understand trends and root causes behind performance fluctuations. Provide actionable insights to the supply (attorneys) and client experience teams to improve processes and outcomes. You will be responsible for not only completing the analysis but also helping shape perspectives on what we should be investigating next. You’re not only helping teams through their requested deepdives but also telling them what they are missing and what we should be looking into next to drive impact.
  • Strategic Insight: Translate data into a compelling narrative that informs business strategy and decision-making. Present findings clearly to various stakeholders, from team members to leadership.

Who you are:

  • Experience: 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst or in a similar role, preferably within the technology sector.
  • Intellectually curious and hungry for impact: you are motivated by constantly leveling up the status quo. You are always looking for the next place to drive impact and are relentless in your hunt to find the next big unlock for business impact
  • Self starter and comfortable with autonomy: you never wait for the next assignment - you are self motivated and comfortable working autonomously
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, BI platforms like Tableau)
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to dissect complex issues and propose effective solutions.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Education: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, or a related discipline
sector: Technology, Information and Internet, Business Consulting and Services, and Marketing Services
title: Business Data Analyst

description: Role :- Sr. Data Analyst ( With Laboratory Experience )  Location- Exton, PA Experience :- 13Years mandatoryOn-site position at State Laboratory in Exton, PACONTRACTOR REQUIREMENTS 1. Points of Contact2. Criminal History Background Check3. Security Access OBJECTIVES OF ENGAGEMENTThe primary objectives of this engagement are to provide business analysis, data analysis, reporting services, and miscellaneous onsite IT support to BOL staff.To achieve these goals, the selected candidate should possess the following skills and experience:Familiarity with laboratory practices (clinical and/or public health laboratory).Familiarity with standardized nomenclatures (LOINC, SNOMED, etc.) used in communicating test orders and results electronically.Experience in troubleshooting issues in a rapidly changing environmentProficiency with Microsoft reporting tools such as SQL Server Reporting Services and Power BI.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, SharePoint, and Visio.Ability to analyze business needs and formalize as system requirements.Ability to work as team member and leader.Ability to build strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Ability to work independently.Strong written and verbal communication skills. OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTSThe selected candidate must be familiar with the Healthcare industry (focus on health information technology) and a variety of IT technologies and methodologies. They will have proven experience in business process analysis, system requirements, data analysis and reporting, and the ability to define needs, analyze problems, recommend solutions, and provide the level of support required to maintain consistent, quality level service.This position is responsible for performing all roles/duties defined in the standard Architect (AR1) Job description.
