description: Requisition Number: 71110The company built on breakthroughs.   Join us.   Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in glass, ceramic, and materials science. From the depths of the ocean to the farthest reaches of space, our technologies push the boundaries of what’s possible.    How do we do this? With our people. They break through limitations and expectations – not once in a career, but every day. They help move our company, and the world, forward.   At Corning, there are endless possibilities for making an impact. You can help connect the unconnected, drive the future of automobiles, transform at-home entertainment, and ensure the delivery of lifesaving medicines. And so much more.   Come break through with us. The global Information Technology (IT) Function is leading efforts to align IT and Business Strategy, leverage IT investments, and optimize end to end business processes and associated information integration technologies. Through these efforts, IT helps to improve the competitive position of Corning's businesses through IT enabled processes. IT also delivers Information Technology applications, infrastructure, and project services in a cost efficient manner to Corning worldwide.Scope Of PositionCorning IT is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support the continuous improvement of our marketing, e-commerce, sales, service, pricing, and employee engagement initiatives . You will play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into meaningful intelligence that drives our commercial strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google BigQuery, Databricks, and Looker Studio. You will develop interactive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to optimize marketing spend, enhance sales effectiveness, and improve customer & employee engagement.In this role, you will contribute to the development and deployment of data-driven solutions for a comprehensive Customer 360 view by integrating data from various customer touchpoints, enabling personalized customer experiences and fostering stronger customer relationships by leveraging data science and machine learning technologies to address complex business challenges. You will also focus on capturing metrics to improve employee experience on the Intranet. Your technical expertise in data analytics tools, combined with your strong analytical and communication skills, will be essential in presenting data-driven recommendations to diverse stakeholders.Responsibilities Build and maintain ETL/ELT data ingestion pipelines from multiple source systems for Digital Marketing, Sales, Service, eCommerce, and Advanced Pricing capabilities into Enterprise Data Lake.  Implement and maintain data collection and governance processes using Google Tag Manager and web analytics tools – author tagging plans, design data layer schema, configure and validate GA4 & GTM, and ensure consent-mode compliant tracking  Ensure data quality through rigorous cleansing, validation, and standardization procedures  Write and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and transformation  Perform complex data analysis using SQL in Data Lake environments such as Google BigQuery and Databricks  Develop analytical data models and schemas to identify customer behavior patterns, trends, and opportunities  Generate actionable insights to support digital marketing campaigns, eCommerce optimization, and pricing strategies  Conduct A/B testing analysis and provide recommendations for optimization  Implement data quality checks, anomaly detection, and reconciliation processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of business-critical data  Conduct root cause analysis on data discrepancies and implement solutions to prevent future issues  Collaborate with product owners and architects to define data integration strategies between marketing, sales, service, eCommerce, advanced pricing platforms and Enterprise Data Lake.  Support integration efforts between marketing, sales, service, eCommerce, advanced pricing platforms and Enterprise Data Lake  Curate and maintain machine learning-ready datasets and semantic layers for advanced analytics and predictive modeling in pricing and customer behavior.  Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio, Power BI or Tableau  Develop automated reporting solutions to track KPIs across digital channels such as funnel conversion and drop-off, campaign performance, lead-to-revenue flow, customer segmentation and cohorts, service case trends, pricing/discount leakage, and profitability drivers  Present data findings and recommendations to stakeholders at various organizational levels  Design visualization solutions that effectively communicate complex data stories  Develop and maintain documentation for data processes, definitions, and analytical methodologies  Collaborate with the Data Management Office to align with enterprise data governance standards  Participate in data governance initiatives, including metadata management, data lineage tracking, and compliance with data privacy regulations, etc.  Partner with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Sales, Service, and Pricing to understand business requirements  Contribute to the development of the Customer 360 data strategy and roadmap  Identify opportunities for process automation and efficiency improvements  Stay current with industry trends and recommend new tools and methodologies Education And Experience Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Data Analytics) or Marketing with a strong analytical focus. Required Skills 2+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis and analytics  Proficiency in SQL with experience in complex query writing and optimization  Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar platforms  Working knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes  Experience with cloud-based data lake platforms (BigQuery, Databricks, or similar)  Strong understanding of web analytics metrics and digital marketing KPIs  Demonstrated ability to translate business questions into analytical approaches  Experience in statistical analysis and data modeling  Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail  Ability to identify data quality issues and implement corrective measures  Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex data to non-technical audiences  Experience working in cross-functional team environments  Strong project management skills with ability to manage multiple priorities  Customer-focused mindset with understanding of customer journey analytics Desired Skills Hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager  Programming experience in Python or R for data analysis  Experience with API integrations and data pipeline development  Knowledge of machine learning concepts and predictive analytics  Familiarity with version control systems (Git)  Experience with data orchestration tools (Qlik, or similar)  Understanding of digital marketing concepts (SEO, SEM, email marketing, personalization)  Knowledge of customer segmentation and lifetime value analysis  Familiarity with pricing analytics and revenue optimization  Experience with privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and their impact on data collection  Self-starter with ability to work independently and take initiative  Agile mindset with adaptability to changing priorities  Passion for continuous learning and staying updated with industry trends  Strong collaboration skills and ability to build relationships across teams  Creative thinking for innovative solution development  Relevant certifications (Google Analytics, Google Cloud, Databricks, etc.) are a plus Travel Requirement Up to 15% This position does not support immigration sponsorship. The range for this position is $72,880.00 - $100,210.00 assuming full time status. Starting pay for the successful applicant is dependent on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to geographic location, market demands, experience, training, and education. The benefits available for this position are dependent on hours worked and may include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan, pension plan, life insurance coverage, disability benefits, and PTO.A job that shapes a life.  Corning offers you the total package.  Your well-being is our priority. Our compensation and benefits package supports your health and wellness, financial, and career from day one As part of our commitment to your financial well-being, we provide a 100% company-paid pension benefit that grows throughout your career. We also offer a 401(k) savings plan with company matching contributions.   Our health and well-being benefits include medical, dental, vision, paid parental leave, family building support, fitness, company-paid life insurance, disability, and disease management programs.  Company-wide bonuses and long-term incentives, align with key business results and ensure you are rewarded when the company performs well – when Corning wins, we all win.      Getting paid for our work is important but feeling appreciated and recognized for those contributions motivates us much more. That’s why Corning offers a peer-to-peer recognition program to celebrate success by recognizing colleagues who demonstrate above-and-beyond behaviors.  We prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .
descriptionHtml:
Requisition Number: 71110

The company built on breakthroughs.   

Join us.  

Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in glass, ceramic, and materials science. From the depths of the ocean to the farthest reaches of space, our technologies push the boundaries of what’s possible.    

How do we do this? With our people. They break through limitations and expectations – not once in a career, but every day. They help move our company, and the world, forward.   

At Corning, there are endless possibilities for making an impact. You can help connect the unconnected, drive the future of automobiles, transform at-home entertainment, and ensure the delivery of lifesaving medicines. And so much more.   

Come break through with us. 

The global Information Technology (IT) Function is leading efforts to align IT and Business Strategy, leverage IT investments, and optimize end to end business processes and associated information integration technologies. Through these efforts, IT helps to improve the competitive position of Corning's businesses through IT enabled processes. IT also delivers Information Technology applications, infrastructure, and project services in a cost efficient manner to Corning worldwide.

Scope Of Position

Corning IT is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support the continuous improvement of our marketing, e-commerce, sales, service, pricing, and employee engagement initiatives . You will play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into meaningful intelligence that drives our commercial strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google BigQuery, Databricks, and Looker Studio. You will develop interactive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to optimize marketing spend, enhance sales effectiveness, and improve customer & employee engagement.

In this role, you will contribute to the development and deployment of data-driven solutions for a comprehensive Customer 360 view by integrating data from various customer touchpoints, enabling personalized customer experiences and fostering stronger customer relationships by leveraging data science and machine learning technologies to address complex business challenges. You will also focus on capturing metrics to improve employee experience on the Intranet. Your technical expertise in data analytics tools, combined with your strong analytical and communication skills, will be essential in presenting data-driven recommendations to diverse stakeholders.

Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain ETL/ELT data ingestion pipelines from multiple source systems for Digital Marketing, Sales, Service, eCommerce, and Advanced Pricing capabilities into Enterprise Data Lake.
  • Implement and maintain data collection and governance processes using Google Tag Manager and web analytics tools – author tagging plans, design data layer schema, configure and validate GA4 & GTM, and ensure consent-mode compliant tracking
  • Ensure data quality through rigorous cleansing, validation, and standardization procedures
  • Write and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and transformation
  • Perform complex data analysis using SQL in Data Lake environments such as Google BigQuery and Databricks
  • Develop analytical data models and schemas to identify customer behavior patterns, trends, and opportunities
  • Generate actionable insights to support digital marketing campaigns, eCommerce optimization, and pricing strategies
  • Conduct A/B testing analysis and provide recommendations for optimization
  • Implement data quality checks, anomaly detection, and reconciliation processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of business-critical data
  • Conduct root cause analysis on data discrepancies and implement solutions to prevent future issues
  • Collaborate with product owners and architects to define data integration strategies between marketing, sales, service, eCommerce, advanced pricing platforms and Enterprise Data Lake.
  • Support integration efforts between marketing, sales, service, eCommerce, advanced pricing platforms and Enterprise Data Lake
  • Curate and maintain machine learning-ready datasets and semantic layers for advanced analytics and predictive modeling in pricing and customer behavior.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio, Power BI or Tableau
  • Develop automated reporting solutions to track KPIs across digital channels such as funnel conversion and drop-off, campaign performance, lead-to-revenue flow, customer segmentation and cohorts, service case trends, pricing/discount leakage, and profitability drivers
  • Present data findings and recommendations to stakeholders at various organizational levels
  • Design visualization solutions that effectively communicate complex data stories
  • Develop and maintain documentation for data processes, definitions, and analytical methodologies
  • Collaborate with the Data Management Office to align with enterprise data governance standards
  • Participate in data governance initiatives, including metadata management, data lineage tracking, and compliance with data privacy regulations, etc.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Sales, Service, and Pricing to understand business requirements
  • Contribute to the development of the Customer 360 data strategy and roadmap
  • Identify opportunities for process automation and efficiency improvements
  • Stay current with industry trends and recommend new tools and methodologies

Education And Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Data Analytics) or Marketing with a strong analytical focus.

Required Skills

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis and analytics
  • Proficiency in SQL with experience in complex query writing and optimization
  • Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar platforms
  • Working knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes
  • Experience with cloud-based data lake platforms (BigQuery, Databricks, or similar)
  • Strong understanding of web analytics metrics and digital marketing KPIs
  • Demonstrated ability to translate business questions into analytical approaches
  • Experience in statistical analysis and data modeling
  • Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail
  • Ability to identify data quality issues and implement corrective measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex data to non-technical audiences
  • Experience working in cross-functional team environments
  • Strong project management skills with ability to manage multiple priorities
  • Customer-focused mindset with understanding of customer journey analytics

Desired Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager
  • Programming experience in Python or R for data analysis
  • Experience with API integrations and data pipeline development
  • Knowledge of machine learning concepts and predictive analytics
  • Familiarity with version control systems (Git)
  • Experience with data orchestration tools (Qlik, or similar)
  • Understanding of digital marketing concepts (SEO, SEM, email marketing, personalization)
  • Knowledge of customer segmentation and lifetime value analysis
  • Familiarity with pricing analytics and revenue optimization
  • Experience with privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and their impact on data collection
  • Self-starter with ability to work independently and take initiative
  • Agile mindset with adaptability to changing priorities
  • Passion for continuous learning and staying updated with industry trends
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to build relationships across teams
  • Creative thinking for innovative solution development
  • Relevant certifications (Google Analytics, Google Cloud, Databricks, etc.) are a plus

Travel Requirement

  • Up to 15%

This position does not support immigration sponsorship.

The range for this position is $72,880.00 - $100,210.00 assuming full time status. Starting pay for the successful applicant is dependent on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to geographic location, market demands, experience, training, and education. The benefits available for this position are dependent on hours worked and may include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan, pension plan, life insurance coverage, disability benefits, and PTO.

A job that shapes a life. 

Corning offers you the total package. 

Your well-being is our priority. Our compensation and benefits package supports your health and wellness, financial, and career from day one

  • As part of our commitment to your financial well-being, we provide a 100% company-paid pension benefit that grows throughout your career. We also offer a 401(k) savings plan with company matching contributions. 
  • Our health and well-being benefits include medical, dental, vision, paid parental leave, family building support, fitness, company-paid life insurance, disability, and disease management programs.
  • Company-wide bonuses and long-term incentives, align with key business results and ensure you are rewarded when the company performs well – when Corning wins, we all win.    
  • Getting paid for our work is important but feeling appreciated and recognized for those contributions motivates us much more. That’s why Corning offers a peer-to-peer recognition program to celebrate success by recognizing colleagues who demonstrate above-and-beyond behaviors. 

We prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .
title: Commercial Data & Analytics Analyst

descriptionHtml:
Charlotte, NC (University area)

Hybrid Role (in office Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday)

Work Hours: 8:00AM – 5:00PM


Brooksource is searching for a Data Center Support Analyst to support our Fortune 500 Energy & Utilities client in Charlotte, NC. The successful candidate will deliver proactive monitoring and issue resolution for data center infrastructure and critical business applications.


Responsibilities

  • Provide proactive and predictive monitoring, support, and problem resolution of all data center infrastructure and software environments, storage, printing, networking, and batch environments.
  • Setup/modify, monitor, and track the client server production batch job flows.
  • Perform Server Reboots or system restarts (IPL) as needed.
  • Provide support internally for any technical issues requiring escalation.
  • Participates on projects teams to provide support and consultation as needed.
  • Participates in rotational schedule to assist with heavy patch deployment nights (e.g. Thursday and Saturday).
  • Participates in ongoing cross-training of technical and process knowledge.
  • Review and complete incident, work order, e-Form, and other IT infrastructure related requests.
  • Lead and participate in service disruption events and disaster recovery exercises.
  • Assists in determining, planning, and implementing necessary changes to the IT infrastructure as needed.
  • Develop and promote standard processes and procedures.
  • Identify and implement automation opportunities.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science
  • In addition to required degree, 1-year related work experience
  • In lieu of Bachelor’s degree(s) AND 1 year(s) related work experience listed above, High School/GED AND 3 year(s) related work experience


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business (MIS) or related discipline.
  • Strong Collaboration and Customer service skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools.
  • Hands-on experience with Cisco enterprise networking product.
  • Familiar with Data Network/Transport Environments.
  • Highly motivated, flexible, and full of initiative.
  • Ability to lead amongst peers to fulfill requests and resolve issues.
  • Ability to analyze, resolve, and document problems and resolution.
  • Strong Written and Verbal communication skills.
  • Experience and working knowledge of:
  • Virtualization Technologies (VMware, Citrix).
  • Data Center working environment.
  • Windows server and desktop operating systems.
  • Linux and UNIX server operating systems.
  • Storage Area Network Infrastructure.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Deliver proactive and predictive monitoring, support, and problem resolution for all data center infrastructure, software environments, storage, printing, networking, and batch environments
  • Provide tier 1 monitoring and support for enterprise infrastructure environments, including client server, Windows, Linux, storage, Citrix, IIS, and web/middleware platforms
  • Setup, modify, monitor, and track client server production batch job flows
  • Perform server reboots or system restarts (IPL) as needed
  • Provide internal support for technical issues requiring escalation
  • Participate on project teams to provide support and consultation as needed
  • Participate in rotational schedule for patch deployment and maintenance windows, including heavy patch deployment nights
  • Engage in ongoing cross-training of technical and process knowledge
  • Review and complete incident, work order, e-Form, and other IT infrastructure related requests
  • Lead and participate in service disruption events and disaster recovery exercises
  • Assist in determining, planning, and implementing necessary changes to IT infrastructure
  • Develop and promote standard processes and procedures
  • Identify and implement automation opportunities to improve efficiency


Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

description: Established bank in Midtown is looking to hire an AML Data Analyst for it's growing team. MUST have experience with analyzing financial crime data/AML/BSA. The position is hybrid, 2x in office.Responsibilities:• Data SME for all BSA/AML and OFAC/Sanctions systems data and data feeds.• Supporting the calibration, optimization and performance evaluation of transaction monitoring systems.• Assisting in the management of data processes• Developing standard, as well as ad-hoc, reports based on FCC leadership needs.• Documenting data feeds, end-to-end data flows and mapping from source to target.• Designing custom structure query language (“SQL”) queries to ensure proper feed validation• Assisting with risk assessments and model validations of the FCC’s AML and Sanctions systems• Assisting in the oversight of FCC systems and other related functions to include (system upgrades and patches, validation/testing of transaction data feeds into the appropriate FCC systems). Design complex custom Structured Query Language (SQL) queries to ensure proper feed validation. Lead the risk assessments and model validations of AFC systems from a data perspective.Requirements:- Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field with experience in systems administration)- Minimum 3+ years of experience in banking compliance or strong knowledge of AML/Sanctions/BSA.- Minimum 3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.- Minimum 3+ year of experience with leading database solutions such as Oracle or MS SQL Server.
descriptionHtml:
Established bank in Midtown is looking to hire an AML Data Analyst for it's growing team. MUST have experience with analyzing financial crime data/AML/BSA. The position is hybrid, 2x in office.


Responsibilities:

• Data SME for all BSA/AML and OFAC/Sanctions systems data and data feeds.

• Supporting the calibration, optimization and performance evaluation of transaction monitoring systems.

• Assisting in the management of data processes

• Developing standard, as well as ad-hoc, reports based on FCC leadership needs.

• Documenting data feeds, end-to-end data flows and mapping from source to target.

• Designing custom structure query language (“SQL”) queries to ensure proper feed validation

• Assisting with risk assessments and model validations of the FCC’s AML and Sanctions systems

• Assisting in the oversight of FCC systems and other related functions to include (system upgrades and patches, validation/testing of transaction data feeds into the appropriate FCC systems). Design complex custom Structured Query Language (SQL) queries to ensure proper feed validation. Lead the risk assessments and model validations of AFC systems from a data perspective.



Requirements:


- Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field with experience in systems administration)

- Minimum 3+ years of experience in banking compliance or strong knowledge of AML/Sanctions/BSA.

- Minimum 3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.

- Minimum 3+ year of experience with leading database solutions such as Oracle or MS SQL Server.
title: AML Data Analyst

descriptionHtml:
Job Description - Senior Data Analyst (Healthcare)

Location: San Francisco, CA (Hybrid: 2–3 days/week in office)

Type: Full-Time

About Onos Health

Onos Health’s mission is simple but ambitious: ensure every healthcare dollar goes toward delivering the highest quality care. Today, 30% of total U.S. healthcare spending is wasted due to ineffective care and administrative burden caused by misalignment between providers and payers.

Onos is addressing this by building the largest AI-driven healthcare data platform. Our models enables payers to make faster, more accurate decisions across their populations. By guiding members to the right care, Onos is channeling more dollars to high-quality care that drives outcomes while making healthcare more affordable.

Onos recently closed a $6M Seed round with top-tier investors and is already working with some of the nation’s largest health plans, signing its first national plan just months after launch.

Come join a category-defining company and help reimagine healthcare for the better.

Why Onos?

  • Meaningful impact: Help fix what is fundamentally broken in healthcare
  • Direct collaboration: Work alongside experienced founders with deep healthcare and data expertise
  • Culture: Join a high-performing, transparent, and results-oriented team
  • Ownership: Significant responsibility and autonomy from day one
  • Opportunity: Play a pivotal role in building a fast-growing, category-defining healthcare AI company

The Role

We’re looking for a Healthcare Data Analyst who thrives in a fast-moving startup, loves working with messy healthcare data, and gets things done. This is not a siloed analyst role; you’ll partner closely with product, engineering, and client-facing teams to turn data into insights that directly shape how payers manage care.

As Onos’ first data analyst, you’ll not only work hands-on with claims, clinical, and operational data to build analyses and dashboards, but also lay the foundation for our data analytics infrastructure. You will take the lead in building analyses and dashboards that uncover waste, identify care gaps, and generate insights that directly inform our product roadmap and drive continuous improvement.

What you'll be doing at Onos:

  • Data Exploration & Analysis: Dive deep into claims and clinical data to uncover trends, outliers, and actionable insights.
  • Client Delivery: Build and deliver analyses that highlight opportunities to reduce waste, improve care, and demonstrate value to payers.
  • Product Insights: Partner with product, engineering, and clinical teams to translate findings into product features, workflows, and automation.
  • Dashboards & Reporting: Design and maintain clear, impactful dashboards that track performance and outcomes.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with the CEO, CPO, and client teams to shape narratives and outcomes for health plan executives.

What we're looking for:

  • 5+ years of experience as a data analyst (healthcare, health plans, or clinical data experience very strongly preferred)
  • Strong SQL and data wrangling skills; comfortable working with large, messy datasets
  • Familiarity with healthcare data standards (claims, eligibility, EHR/clinical data, coding sets like ICD, CPT, HCPCS)
  • Experience building dashboards (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar) and communicating insights clearly
  • Proven ability to “own” both analysis and execution
  • Scrappy with an entrepreneurial mindset: resourceful, proactive, thrives in ambiguity, and moves fast
  • Excellent communication skills an ability to translate complex data into clear business insights
  • Exceptional references from colleagues and former managers

Benefits And Perks

  • Flexible hybrid arrangement: 2-3 days/week at San Francisco office (Financial District)
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Paid parental leave
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits
  • 401(k)
  • Significant equity as an early employee
  • Direct mentorship from experienced founders
  • Ground-floor opportunity to help build a team and culture
  • Regular team events and offsites
  • Company-provided equipment and home office setup

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Compensation Range: $150K - $180K
title: Senior Data Analyst

description: Company OverviewEnterprise Horizon Consulting Group (EHCG) is a Woman-Owned Small Business specializing in IT Consulting which has successfully delivered key capabilities to the Navy, Army, and NASA over the past 15+ years. EHCG provides best in class services to its customers in the following areas: Business Systems Services; Business Intelligence; Data Analytics and Dashboarding; Enterprise Resource Planning (SAP) Implementation; Legacy System Optimization; Digital Transformation; Cloud Migration; Integration and Modernization; and Risk Management Framework Processes (RMF).Job DescriptionEnterprise Horizon is seeking an experienced SAP Data Analyst focused on BW/4HANA. You'll play a critical role in shaping how our client captures, structures, and leverages enterprise data across logistics, finance, and acquisition domains. This role blends technical depth with mission-driven analytics, supporting decision-makers across our client's enterprise.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and maintain BW/4HANA data models, InfoProviders, CompositeProviders, and ADSOs aligned with client S/4HANA architecture. Collaborate with functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable reporting solutions. descriptionHtml:
Company Overview

Enterprise Horizon Consulting Group (EHCG) is a Woman-Owned Small Business specializing in IT Consulting which has successfully delivered key capabilities to the Navy, Army, and NASA over the past 15+ years. EHCG provides best in class services to its customers in the following areas: Business Systems Services; Business Intelligence; Data Analytics and Dashboarding; Enterprise Resource Planning (SAP) Implementation; Legacy System Optimization; Digital Transformation; Cloud Migration; Integration and Modernization; and Risk Management Framework Processes (RMF).

Job Description

Enterprise Horizon is seeking an experienced SAP Data Analyst focused on BW/4HANA. You'll play a critical role in shaping how our client captures, structures, and leverages enterprise data across logistics, finance, and acquisition domains. This role blends technical depth with mission-driven analytics, supporting decision-makers across our client's enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain BW/4HANA data models, InfoProviders, CompositeProviders, and ADSOs aligned with client S/4HANA architecture.
  • Collaborate with functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable reporting solutions.
  • Build and optimize CDS views, OData services, and data extraction logic from S/4HANA core modules.
  • Support data migration, data quality validation, and reporting readiness for client deployments.
  • Develop dashboards and analytics using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) or embedded BW tools.
  • Ensure compliance with DoD data governance, RMF, and auditability standards.
  • Participate in Agile sprints, backlog grooming, and DevSecOps workflows.
  • Experience with best practices to determine if an analytic process should run in S/4HANA (Real-time operational reporting on transactional data) vs BW/4HANA (Requirements that integrate SAP and non-SAP sources and/or analytics that require historical data, complex transformations, or data harmonization).

Requirements

  • Bachelors or equivalent substitution (Associates + 2 years' experience; High School Diploma + 4 years' experience; or relevant professional certification)
  • Active Secret Clearance preferred
  • 5+ years of SAP data analytics experience, including 2+ years with BW/4HANA
  • Proficiency in S/4HANA data structures, CDS views, and ABAP-based data extraction
  • Experience with SAP BW Query Designer, Eclipse, and SAP HANA Studio
  • Familiarity with DoD data governance, FISMA, and RMF frameworks
  • Strong communication skills and ability to present insights to technical and executive audiences

Preferred Skills

  • Hands-on with SAP Analytics Cloud, Fiori reporting, or Power BI integration
  • Knowledge of federal financial and logistics data structures (e.g., STARS-FL, DAI, DPAS)
  • Experience with Git, Jira, and CI/CD pipelines

Benefits

Benefits

We offer full-time salaried employees competitive salaries with a range of benefits, including:

  • Medical, Dental, & Vision
  • Life Insurance, Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability
  • SIMPLE IRA with Company Match
  • Federal Holidays
  • Vacation & Sick Leave

$500 Referral Bonus

If this position is not a perfect fit for you, but you know someone who would be a great match, please refer them to us via our Candidate Referral Program by going to: www.enterprisehorizon.com/candidatereferrals. If we hire them, you could receive $500! See the link for further details.

Enterprise Horizon Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer. Enterprise Horizon Consulting Group does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and over), physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.

descriptionHtml:
JOB TITLE: Fraud Data Analyst (Merchant and Loan)

LOCATION: Las Vegas

REPORTS TO: Head of Business Data Analytics


The Company:

Sunbit builds financial technology for real life. Our technology eases the stress of paying for life’s expenses by giving people more options on how and when they pay. Founded in 2016, Sunbit offers a next-generation, no-fee credit card that can be managed through a powerful mobile app, as well as a point-of-sale payment option available at more than 25,000 service locations, including 1 in 2 auto dealerships, optical practices, dentist offices, veterinary clinics, and specialty healthcare services. By introducing a flexible way to pay over time, we are proud of our ability to lift up service providers and retailers while helping consumers when necessary expenses arise... regardless of whether they were expected or unexpected. Sunbit was included on the 2022 Inc. 5000 list. The financial technology company has also been named as a Most Loved Workplace®, Best Point of Sale Company, and as a Top Fintech Startup by CB Insights. We use cutting-edge innovations in financial technology to bring leading data and features that allow individuals to be qualified instantly, making purchases at the point-of-sale fast, fair and easy for consumers from all walks of life. We create value focused on our core values; we work tirelessly to ensure that Sunbit becomes available to everyone, everywhere.

Sunbit is proud to be recognized on the CB Insights List of Unicorn Companies, with a valuation of $1.1B (https://www.cbinsights.com/research-unicorn-companies)


The Role:

This role is part of the Business Data Analytics team at Sunbit, reporting to the Head of Data. In this position, you will work closely with the Business Unit (BU) leaders of Fraud, using data to identify and research fraudulent activities while measuring and monitoring the company’s overall fraud objectives. You will collaborate cross-functionally with machine learning, product engineering, and fraud operations to help foster a safe platform for our customers.


What You'll Own:

  • Support Fraud department leaders in their analytical research and emerging trends analysis, focusing on Merchant and loan fraud
  • Monitor key fraud metrics to proactively identify and address potential risks
  • Respond quickly to fraud rings and collaborate with the business to implement new strategies to mitigate emerging fraud threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Assist other Fraud Analysts in developing the fraud monitoring strategy
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to improve fraud insights
  • Assist with the evaluation and implementation of new external or internal features and signals to enhance fraud detection capabilities
  • Support the simulation of Sunbit KPIs for major fraud strategy changes


We are looking for someone who:

  • Is proficient in data analysis using SQL and excited to acquire new technical skills
  • Has strong analytical skills with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in data
  • Has experience with scripting languages, such as Python or R, for data analysis (preferred)
  • Possesses strong verbal, written communication, and presentation skills
  • Can clearly communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Has experience with BI tools (Sigma is a plus)
  • Has experience in Credit Card, Loans, or other financial services instrument
  • Is passionate about solving real-world problems with data
  • Has passion for understanding and improving fraud detection systems to effectively identify and mitigate fraudulent activities.
  • Has experience in fraud prevention, risk management, or related fields (preferred)
  • Can see the big picture and can think long-term
  • Possesses a growth mindset and takes proactive ownership of projects
  • Lives the 80/20 principle and gets things done
  • Has 6+ years of relevant analytical experience with a bachelor’s degree or 4+ years of relevant experience with a master’s degree in a quantitative field (Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, etc.)


The Perks:

  • Join one of LA’s fastest growing startups (2023), A Most Loved Workplace, #576 on the 2023 Inc 5000 list, and Forbes Fintech 50 (2024)
  • Mission driven + empowered + collaborative
  • Competitive pay and stock options
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Health Insurance options including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, EAP, FSA, & Maternity Leave
  • Newly added HSA and Pet Insurance
  • 401K Plan with Matching
  • Cell Phone Stipend
  • Casual Dress
  • Open door policy / Open office floor plan
  • Team based strategic planning + Team owned deliverables


Core Values for Success at Sunbit:

  • Serve others before self - Focus on analytics that drive collective progress and support company-wide goals
  • Own the impact - Take full responsibility for accuracy and implications of your data insights
  • Connect genuinely - Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders
  • Act fast - Demonstrate agility and responsiveness in a fast paced environment
  • Include always - Ensure inclusivity in your analytical approach by considering diverse perspectives and impacts
  • Innovate for good - Continually seek opportunities to improve and innovate in the realm of data analytics at Sunbit


Sunbit is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to provide a professional & welcoming workplace for all employees.
title: Fraud Data Analyst

descriptionHtml:
The Barcelona Institute for Global Health (ISGlobal) is a cutting-edge institute addressing global public health challenges through research, translation into policy and education. ISGlobal has a broad portfolio in communicable and non-communicable diseases including environmental and climate determinants, and applies a multidisciplinary scientific approach ranging from the molecular to the population level. Research is organized in five programs: Climate, Air Pollution, Nature and Urban Health; Environment and Health over the Lifecourse; Global Viral and Bacterial Infections; Malaria and Neglected Parasitic Diseases and Maternal Child and Reproductive Health. ISGlobal is accredited with the Severo Ochoa distinction, a seal of excellence of the Spanish Science Ministry.

What We Are Looking For

ISGlobal is looking for a proactive Data Analyst/Statistician with experience in epidemiology and/or clinical trials to provide statistical and data‐management support across multiple projects within the International Health Service at Hospital Clínic de Barcelona (https://www.clinicbarcelona.org/en/service/international-health). You will contribute to study design, database setup, data cleaning, statistical analysis and data reporting. Working closely with multidisciplinary teams, you will ensure methodological rigor, timely deliverables and data-driven insights that advance our global-health objectives.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support Statistical Planning: Assist in defining and reviewing the statistical framework, including sample size calculations and analysis schedules.
  • Contribute Methodological Expertise: Provide statistical input on study documents, help troubleshoot analysis questions and support the preparation of reports and publications.
  • Maintain Data Infrastructure: Contribute to ensuring data integrity, quality, and accessibility for analyses.
  • Document Processes: Write and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs), protocols, and documentation to support reproducible workflows.
  • Provide Data Insights: Create basic data visualizations and perform exploratory analyses to support decision-making.

SPECIFIC DUTIES

  • Protocol and Documentation Support: Draft and update statistical sections of clinical protocols, technical appendices, and SOPs to ensure alignment with regulatory and methodological standards.
  • Data Preparation and Analysis: Develop and run reproducible R, Python, and SQL scripts for data cleaning, transformation, and exploratory analysis.
  • Statistical Programming: Contribute to routine analyses such as summary tables and regression models, and assist in compiling interim and final statistical reports with clear, well-documented code.
  • Data Visualization: Produce clear, informative visualizations to communicate key findings and support decision-making.
  • Collaboration and Review: Participate in statistical review of study documents, contribute methodological input cross-functional meetings, and respond to analysis-related queries from clinical and operational teams.

AUXILIAR TASKS

This job description reflects the present requirements of the post but may evolve at any time in the future as duties and responsibilities change and/or develop providing there is appropriate consultation with the post-holder.

This job description is not a definitive or exhaustive list of responsibilities but identifies the key responsibilities and tasks of the post holder. The specific objectives of the post holder will be subject to review as part of the individual professional assessment process.

Skills

  • Advanced Statistical Methodology: Proven experience applying statistical techniques (e.g. linear and multiple regression, tree-based models such as XGBoost or Decision Trees, survival analysis, longitudinal data analysis) to support insights in clinical, epidemiological or related research settings.
  • Programming Proficiency: Expert-level skills in Python (pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn), and strong working knowledge of R (tidyverse, R, Markdown, Shiny), and SQL.
  • Communication & Collaboration: Ability to translate statistical findings into clear recommendations for both technical and non‐technical audiences.

The post holder will adhere to ISGlobal principles contained in People management policy, including Equity, diversity and health safety. The post holder will respect, and be accountable to ensure ISGlobal policies and procedures.

Training And Experience / Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Degree or Master in Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics, Epidemiology, Biological Science or a related quantitative discipline.
  • Professional Experience: At least three years of experience in data analysis, data engineering, or statistician. At least one year of experience in epidemiological research or in clinical trials. With experience in scientific research and publications preferred.
  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in English and Spanish, both written and spoken. Additional languages are an asset.

LANGUAGE LEVEL

  • Proficiency in English and Spanish.

CONDITIONS

  • Duration: 6 months + 6 months
  • Starting date: As soon as possible
  • Contract Type: Full time
  • Salary: Technician II A (30.055€ gross annual)

How To Apply

Applicants must fill in the request form and attach the CV and a Cover Letter. Each attached document must be named with the candidate name and surname.

The receipt of applications will be open until 7th of October 2025.

The interviews could be placed during the reception of candidatures period.

Diverse candidatures are encouraged, that includes: gender, race, ethnicity, religion, age, sexual orientation, physical abilities, and political views.

SELECTION PROCESS

The Selection Process Is Designed In Two Phases

1- Interview phase of a technical nature, with the team that requires the incorporation. To assess the person's skills and CV.

2 - Meeting with HR with the finalist(s) to finish assessing the profile and discuss contractual and institutional issues.

If needed any technical test could be passed. A Psychological Competency Evaluation Test will be required for the structural or transversal positions.

In accordance with the OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for every vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will start the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. A profile questionnaire as well as a technical exercise may be required during the process.

In ISGlobal we are committed to maintaining and developing a work environment in which the values and principles of our organization are respected and equal opportunities between women and men be promoted in each of the areas in which we operate, not tolerating discrimination based on criteria such as age, gender, marital status, race, ethnicity, functional diversity, political leanings, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

We confirm our commitment towards the value of the diversity of our staff and student population and seek to promote peace, equity, diversity and inclusion as essential elements in contribution to improving health worldwide.
title: Data Analyst/Statistician for International Health department

description: hackajob is collaborating with UnitedHealth Group to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health optimization on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesMaintain, optimize, document, and manage data processes in primarily Cloud based environment (APIs, Kafka, Azure Databricks (Terraforms), Snowflake, GitHub) to ensure solution meets business needs in terms of security, scalability, reliability and feasibility.Use technical skills to manipulate data using SQL, Snowflake, Excel, or other tools to provide actionable information to internal customers in support of their business goals by business & product line.Help build reporting and data visualizations to create data driven analytics that drive strategies and measure interventions to ensure our populations to achieve 4+ Star goals.Recommends and implements new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information. Assists in testing new reports and ongoing support of existing solutions, including defect identification and resolution.Ensure completion of yearly projects in support of team specific roadmap items that support business goalsBuild best practice data quality monitoring to ensure all data/report products exceed customer expectations. Incorporate quality into the planning/design phases; build quality assurance activities; utilize data audits; identify and fix root causes vs short term solutionsDesign and review data structures for data management purposes with teamSupport team members by leading projects, sharing ideas and reviewing work of others. Work with internal business partners to interpret, develop, & document report specifications, provide data-driven direction & guidance for Stars and clinical quality improvementAnticipate end user data needs, be curious and proactively communicate ideas to stakeholdersUtilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Pro-actively identifies patterns in issues and research root-cause to improve overall qualityCreate best practice and use best practice in deliverablesAssist in processes to collect, cleanse and enrich data coming into our data platformEvaluate data and reports for accuracy and validity; ensure that reporting meets customer requirements / regulationsSupport analysis of complex data for trending and patterns; recognize significance of findings and identify improvement opportunities; participate in making program and process recommendationsKeep a full load and manage multiple projects being able to report out on progress and present analyses and findings to various stakeholdersYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required Qualifications4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst utilizing SQL4+ years of ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) experience in tools such as Alteryx, Streamlit or Python3+ years of experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and/or evaluation of business processes2+ years of Cloud experience using APIs, Kafka, Azure Databricks (Terraforms), GitHubProficient with Microsoft software programs (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, etc.)Demonstrated ability to interpret Clinical Quality, HEDIS, and/or Pharmacy measure specificationsDemonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, complex organization managing multiple projectsDemonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task in high volume workload situationsProven skilled in communication, both written and verbalProven solid interpersonal skills and ability to interact collaboratively with internal business partners across multiple departmentsProven excellent analytical and problem-solving capabilities with special attention to accuracy and detail.Proven self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership of job responsibilities and ensure successful completion of all projects and requestsPreferred QualificationsKnowledge of and experience using HEDIS, Pharmacy or Medicare Star RatingsWorking with healthcare data to support end user data requirementsExperience using large, diverse healthcare data for analytic purposesUnderstanding of Star Rating, PQA, HEDIS and NCQA technical specifications to apply measure criteriaDemonstrated ability to mentor and support team membersProven excellent communication skills, both written and verbalProven highly analytical, curious, and creativeProven comfortable working in a rapidly-changing environmentAll employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The salary for this role will range from $89,900 to $160,600 annually based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.Application Deadline: This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
descriptionHtml:
hackajob is collaborating with UnitedHealth Group to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health optimization on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Maintain, optimize, document, and manage data processes in primarily Cloud based environment (APIs, Kafka, Azure Databricks (Terraforms), Snowflake, GitHub) to ensure solution meets business needs in terms of security, scalability, reliability and feasibility.
  • Use technical skills to manipulate data using SQL, Snowflake, Excel, or other tools to provide actionable information to internal customers in support of their business goals by business & product line.
  • Help build reporting and data visualizations to create data driven analytics that drive strategies and measure interventions to ensure our populations to achieve 4+ Star goals.
  • Recommends and implements new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information. Assists in testing new reports and ongoing support of existing solutions, including defect identification and resolution.
  • Ensure completion of yearly projects in support of team specific roadmap items that support business goals
  • Build best practice data quality monitoring to ensure all data/report products exceed customer expectations. Incorporate quality into the planning/design phases; build quality assurance activities; utilize data audits; identify and fix root causes vs short term solutions
  • Design and review data structures for data management purposes with team
  • Support team members by leading projects, sharing ideas and reviewing work of others. Work with internal business partners to interpret, develop, & document report specifications, provide data-driven direction & guidance for Stars and clinical quality improvement
  • Anticipate end user data needs, be curious and proactively communicate ideas to stakeholders
  • Utilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Pro-actively identifies patterns in issues and research root-cause to improve overall quality
  • Create best practice and use best practice in deliverables
  • Assist in processes to collect, cleanse and enrich data coming into our data platform
  • Evaluate data and reports for accuracy and validity; ensure that reporting meets customer requirements / regulations
  • Support analysis of complex data for trending and patterns; recognize significance of findings and identify improvement opportunities; participate in making program and process recommendations
  • Keep a full load and manage multiple projects being able to report out on progress and present analyses and findings to various stakeholders

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst utilizing SQL
  • 4+ years of ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) experience in tools such as Alteryx, Streamlit or Python
  • 3+ years of experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and/or evaluation of business processes
  • 2+ years of Cloud experience using APIs, Kafka, Azure Databricks (Terraforms), GitHub
  • Proficient with Microsoft software programs (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret Clinical Quality, HEDIS, and/or Pharmacy measure specifications
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, complex organization managing multiple projects
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task in high volume workload situations
  • Proven skilled in communication, both written and verbal
  • Proven solid interpersonal skills and ability to interact collaboratively with internal business partners across multiple departments
  • Proven excellent analytical and problem-solving capabilities with special attention to accuracy and detail.
  • Proven self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership of job responsibilities and ensure successful completion of all projects and requests

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of and experience using HEDIS, Pharmacy or Medicare Star Ratings
  • Working with healthcare data to support end user data requirements
  • Experience using large, diverse healthcare data for analytic purposes
  • Understanding of Star Rating, PQA, HEDIS and NCQA technical specifications to apply measure criteria
  • Demonstrated ability to mentor and support team members
  • Proven excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Proven highly analytical, curious, and creative
  • Proven comfortable working in a rapidly-changing environment
  • All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The salary for this role will range from $89,900 to $160,600 annually based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.

Application Deadline: This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
